commit_message:
move branched containers-multinode to non-voting

The non-branched containers-multinode will
also need to moved to non-voting

Related-Bug: #1929634
Change-Id: Ia91a17e4f272215155a33c6ee72ea51d1aa8a938

commit_message:
Improve manila ping test for scenario004

Replace the current api test with a scenario test that will
provide end-to-end coverage of the manila and ganesha services.

Change-Id: I39a61880190a964184d0ab6664315df6e5b5402c

subject: Switch to using DNS when connecting to etcd and fix an if: regression
messages:
[{'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2021-05-15 13:33:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 21129, 'date': '2021-05-17 13:44:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

Actually, TLS is happy to use an IP address as long as the cert contains an IP SAN (subject alternative name) for that address. I had to fiddle with the etcd service template to set another one up, which in turn requires using ansible-ipa instead of the old nova-join. But I digress.

I do agree that switching to a domain name makes sense (assuming, of course, the name can always be resolved, either by DNS or an entry in /etc/hosts).

However, I was curious what triggered the failure that led to this patch, because everything was presumed to already be working (is this a regression?). While I'm not sure, I wonder if the recent failure was triggered by a bug in another recent patch, as I note in another comment."}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2021-05-19 19:16:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

Thanks Alan!

> Patch Set 1:
> Actually, TLS is happy to use an IP address as long as the cert contains an IP SAN (subject alternative name) for that address. I had to fiddle with the etcd service template to set another one up, which in turn requires using ansible-ipa instead of the old nova-join. But I digress.
> I do agree that switching to a domain name makes sense (assuming, of course, the name can always be resolved, either by DNS or an entry in /etc/hosts).

Yeah we could add a SAN like folks are doing for memcached in https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/+/792131/. Using DNS only, unless there is no way around it, feels a bit cleaner, I agree.

> However, I was curious what triggered the failure that led to this patch, because everything was presumed to already be working (is this a regression?). While I'm not sure, I wonder if the recent failure was triggered by a bug in another recent patch, as I note in another comment.

Good point, I just tried it for the first time so not sure if this is a regression.

Let me amend this review, retest the whole thing and I'll comment here."}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2021-05-19 19:20:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-05-19 19:23:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2021-05-19 19:25:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2021-05-19 19:26:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2021-05-19 19:26:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow-1

setting -W until I test it in my env'}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2021-09-14 15:41:34.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Abandoning this patch per the TripleO Patch Abandonment guidelines
(https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/tripleo-specs/specs/policy/patch-abandonment.html).
If you wish to have this restored and cannot do so yourself, please reach out
via #tripleo on OFTC or the OpenStack Dev mailing list.'}]

[{'created': '2021-05-15 13:33:20.000000000', 'message': 'Switch to using DNS when connecting to etcd

We currently use the IP address to connect to etcd. For example when it
is configured to listen on the main network it connects to the IP as
follows:
/etc/puppet/hieradata/service_configs.json:    "tripleo::profile::base::cinder::volume::etcd_host": "%{hiera('main_network')}",
[root@ctrl-1-0 ~]# hiera -c /etc/puppet/hiera.yaml tripleo::profile::base::cinder::volume::etcd_host
172.30.1.1

So in a TLS-E environment we end up with the following coordination URL:
backend_url=etcd3+https://172.30.1.1:2379?cert_key=/etc/pki/tls/private/etcd.key&cert_cert=/etc/pki/tls/certs/etcd.crt

The problem with the above is that TLS will decline to connect to an IP
(unless you disable verification) and so it errors out with:

commit_message:
Switch to using DNS when connecting to etcd and fix an if: regression

We currently use the IP address to connect to etcd. For example when it
is configured to listen on the main network it connects to the IP as
follows:
/etc/puppet/hieradata/service_configs.json:    "tripleo::profile::base::cinder::volume::etcd_host": "%{hiera('main_network')}",
[root@ctrl-1-0 ~]# hiera -c /etc/puppet/hiera.yaml tripleo::profile::base::cinder::volume::etcd_host
172.30.1.1

So in a TLS-E environment we end up with the following coordination URL:
backend_url=etcd3+https://172.30.1.1:2379?cert_key=/etc/pki/tls/private/etcd.key&cert_cert=/etc/pki/tls/certs/etcd.crt

The problem with the above is that TLS will decline to connect to an IP
(unless you disable verification) and so it errors out with:

2021-05-15 08:00:36.472 1613 INFO cinder.service [-] Starting cinder-volume node (version 18.0.0)
2021-05-15 08:00:36.501 1613 WARNING urllib3.connection [-] Certificate did not match expected hostname: 172.30.1.1. I see what you are doing here, but this is something that I have been working on trying to do automatically in order to make the templates compatible with both ifcfg and nmstate implementations. My intention was to automatically create an internal interface with a name derived from the bridge name (but different), and to automatically assign IP addresses declared on the bridge to the internal interface. I'll work on this today and update my WIP impl_nmstate change so you can take a look."}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-05-18 22:01:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

yea it would be good to have this magically handled when an ovs bridge is defined. revisions:
[{'created': '2021-04-14 20:37:33.000000000', 'message': "[WIP] ovs-interface support

In order to correctly add an interface when using nmstate, the address
has to be added to an ovs-interface and not an ovs-bridge. Historically
this was magically handled as part of the legacy network-scripts but
nmstate wants this to be correctly defined or it'll not validate.

You need to be able to do something like:

    network_config:
    - type: ovs_bridge
      name: br-ctlplane
      use_dhcp: false
      ovs_extra:
      - br-set-external-id br-ctlplane bridge-id br-ctlplane
      routes: []
      dns_servers: ['1.1.1.1', '1.0.0.1']
      domain: []
      members:
        - type: interface
          name: eth1
          primary: true
          mtu: 1400
        - type: ovs-interface
          name: br-ctlplane
          mtu: 1400
          addresses:
          - ip_netmask: 192.168.24.1/24
          - ip_netmask: 192.168.24.3/32
          - ip_netmask: 192.168.24.2/32

Change-Id: I653151d39635cb0988306e2fdfbd4fbf5352f34f
"}, {'created': '2021-04-14 21:45:17.000000000', 'message': "[WIP] ovs-interface support

In order to correctly add an interface when using nmstate, the address
has to be added to an ovs-interface and not an ovs-bridge. Historically
this was magically handled as part of the legacy network-scripts but
nmstate wants this to be correctly defined or it'll not validate.

You need to be able to do something like:

    network_config:
    - type: ovs_bridge
      name: br-ctlplane
      use_dhcp: false
      ovs_extra:
      - br-set-external-id br-ctlplane bridge-id br-ctlplane

Change-Id: I653151d39635cb0988306e2fdfbd4fbf5352f34f
"}]
commit_message:
[WIP] ovs-interface support

In order to correctly add an interface when using nmstate, the address
has to be added to an ovs-interface and not an ovs-bridge. Historically
this was magically handled as part of the legacy network-scripts but
nmstate wants this to be correctly defined or it'll not validate.

You need to be able to do something like:

    network_config:
    - type: ovs_bridge
      name: br-ctlplane
      use_dhcp: false
      ovs_extra:
      - br-set-external-id br-ctlplane bridge-id br-ctlplane
      routes: []
      dns_servers: ['1.1.1.1', '1.0.0.1']
      domain: []
      members:
        - type: interface
          name: eth1
          primary: true
          mtu: 1400
        - type: ovs-interface
          name: ctlplane
          mtu: 1400
          addresses:
          - ip_netmask: 192.168.24.1/24
          - ip_netmask: 192.168.24.3/32
          - ip_netmask: 192.168.24.2/32

Change-Id: I653151d39635cb0988306e2fdfbd4fbf5352f34f

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-01-29 15:15:14.000000000', 'message': 'WIP Only target the local memcached when it is co-located

In an HA control plane, when a controller node is in outage,
memcached clients can randomly target the memcached instance that
is hosted on the misbehaving controller, and impact service.

Change the memcached configuration such that when a client is
co-located with the memcache service, it always uses its local
memcached instance. This avoids random impact due to node outage,
at the expense of removing HA for the memcached service.

Change-Id: I81561698c52e6e2a8628983dc809245db73f32dc
Closes-Bug: #1913733
'}, {'created': '2021-02-09 11:01:42.000000000', 'message': 'WIP Only target the local memcached when it is co-located

In an HA control plane, when a controller node is in outage,
memcached clients can randomly target the memcached instance that
is hosted on the misbehaving controller, and impact service.

Change the memcached configuration such that when a client is
co-located with the memcache snd haproxy services, it always uses its local
memcached instance. This avoids random impact due to node outage,
at the expense of removing HA for the memcached service.

When both haproxy and memcache are collocated with the client, haproxy
proxies memcached on localhost and the client uses that endpoint. In that
case, haproxy only targets the local memcached, and can failover to
remote memcached, so HA is retained.

Change-Id: I81561698c52e6e2a8628983dc809245db73f32dc
Closes-Bug: #1913733
'}, {'created': '2021-04-21 20:23:13.000000000', 'message': 'WIP Only target the local memcached when it is co-located

In an HA control plane, when a controller node is in outage,
memcached clients can randomly target the memcached instance that
is hosted on the misbehaving controller, and impact service.

Change the memcached configuration such that when a client is
co-located with the memcache snd haproxy services, it always uses its local
memcached instance. This avoids random impact due to node outage,
at the expense of removing HA for the memcached service.

commit_message:
WIP Only target the local memcached when it is co-located

In an HA control plane, when a controller node is in outage,
memcached clients can randomly target the memcached instance that
is hosted on the misbehaving controller, and impact service.

Change the memcached configuration such that when a client is
co-located with the memcache snd haproxy services, it always uses its local
memcached instance. This avoids random impact due to node outage,
at the expense of removing HA for the memcached service.

When both haproxy and memcache are collocated with the client, haproxy
proxies memcached on localhost and the client uses that endpoint. In that
case, haproxy only targets the local memcached, and can failover to
remote memcached, so HA is retained.

Change-Id: I81561698c52e6e2a8628983dc809245db73f32dc
Closes-Bug: #1913733

commit_message:
FFU: change transfer parameters for database resync

Configure tripleo_transfer's flags to mimick the way a galera SST
transfers the entire database between two nodes: in-place copy,
no delta-transfer, no compression, selective file copy.

Change-Id: I557962e77d6558281603b40d0adf01b912e8c2f9
Closes-Bug: #1925260
Depends-On: I1e88907db0bb26d52c92cb996eb56767e06b3874
(cherry picked from commit 47fb02f207630efe9b9ac651e53c746d57afb377)

commit_message:
[wip]Remove Nova keypair generation for Octavia.

For Octavia SSH pub key we uses the existing 'default' keypair from the undercloud.
But, In master nova service is removed from the undercloud so compute endpoint
is not available anymore.

Reverting back to using '/home/stack/.ssh/id_rsa.pub' file to set Octavia SSH
pub key as used earlier[1]

[1 ]https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/+/568022

Closes-Bug: #1907112
Change-Id: I1f700517e6e3375838d84291c2bcd9cbda92dce7

Adding this kind of commands in TripleO is not nice, especially to set config within the ceph cluster.

I don't want to block things though, and if it's really required via a tripleo task the approach [1] is the best one imo"}, {'account_id': 29268, 'date': '2021-02-12 13:58:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-06 19:35:15.000000000', 'message': 'Enable the pg balancer for Ceph, and set the mode to upmap

Since we are enforcing the minumum Ceph client version to be Mimic
we can now enable the placement group balancer and set the mode
to upmap. This is useful in that the Ceph cluster will now have a
more balanced distribution across OSDs.

https: //docs.ceph.com/en/nautilus/rados/operations/balancer/
Change-Id: I94db8a088b811c3a9d49c5e24807e87c8b51dac2
'}, {'created': '2021-02-11 19:55:05.000000000', 'message': 'Enable the placement group balancer for Ceph

While CRUSH does a decent job in balancing data across OSDs. It
is not perfect and there are common scenarios where one or more
OSDs will fill up first in a cluster. Enabling the pg balancer
provides a more balanced distribution across OSDs, which elevates
this issue.

https: //docs.ceph.com/en/nautilus/rados/operations/balancer/
Change-Id: I94db8a088b811c3a9d49c5e24807e87c8b51dac2
'}]
commit_message:
Enable the placement group balancer for Ceph

While CRUSH does a decent job in balancing data across OSDs. It
is not perfect and there are common scenarios where one or more
OSDs will fill up first in a cluster. Enabling the pg balancer
provides a more balanced distribution across OSDs, which elevates
this issue.

https: //docs.ceph.com/en/nautilus/rados/operations/balancer/
Change-Id: I94db8a088b811c3a9d49c5e24807e87c8b51dac2

subject: WIP: improve usability of per-role NovaEnableRbdBackend
messages:
[{'account_id': 23811, 'date': '2020-05-15 16:52:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2020-05-15 16:57:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 23811, 'date': '2020-05-15 17:52:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 23811, 'date': '2020-05-15 17:55:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2020-05-18 11:33:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

if I understand correctly, glance_multiple_locations is only relevant for glance-api and when using ceph-ansible.yaml env file it will be enabled (because both glance and nova will by default use rbd)

why do we want/need to make this change at all? if there are "special" nova roles where we don't use rbd, can't we just set NovaEnableRbdBackend:false for that role only?'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2020-05-18 12:07:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2020-05-18 14:02:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Code-Review

> if I understand correctly, glance_multiple_locations is only
 > relevant for glance-api and when using ceph-ansible.yaml env file
 > it will be enabled (because both glance and nova will by default
 > use rbd)
 
We all talked some more on IRC. I'll try to summarize below.

 > why do we want/need to make this change at all? 

Reasons for this change:
The user is going to implicitly get the result of GlanceShowMultipleLocations=true
whenever they -e environments/ceph-ansible.yaml. If you believe explicit is better
than implicit, then why not just make it explict? Why don't we do this for the user
instead of requiring them to know it's happening implicitly so they can then set it
themselves?

Reasons against this change:
It's not technically necessary as users can just override as they need to. It's supposed 
to simplify the per-role usecase but does it result better usability for all other cases?
If we merge this, then how far do we backport it? What if it introduces unexpected bugs?
Does making the change cause confusion?


 > if there are
 > "special" nova roles where we don't use rbd, can't we just set
 > NovaEnableRbdBackend:false for that role only?

We have those types of roles already. 

https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/master/roles/ComputeLocalEphemeral.yaml'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2021-03-26 20:52:48.000000000', 'content': 'Removed reviewer John Fulton.'}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2021-09-14 15:40:08.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Abandoning this patch per the TripleO Patch Abandonment guidelines
(https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/tripleo-specs/specs/policy/patch-abandonment.html).

via #tripleo on OFTC or the OpenStack Dev mailing list.'}]

commit_message:
[WIP] Remove dependency on github repo for tripleo_collectd

If the dependencies exist in $HOME/src/github.com/... then
skip galaxy install and use the local versions. The
dependencies are expected to exist here is zuul is used and
has added these projects to the image.

This would also enable using some local versions during
development.

Depends-On: I3ffc52e38708211f090319a63b9d794d0376223a
Depends-On: I7ce2166a752856d426938715c026a1a54bac9380
Change-Id: I00ce9d32ab1862087f41ce7538e6d132e04e0568

This playbook will allow operators to verify that the
restored systems are functioning as expected through
the use of tripleo-validation roles.

Add validation support to backup and restore cli.

This addition to the tripleoclient will give the operator the
command line option to call the system validation roles from
tripleo-validations.

commit_message:
Check container build status to avoid push and pull

Container build status is not getting validated which
leads to failure of container push and pull.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-common/+/774424

Closes-Bug: #1914061

Change-Id: I84db635c86f8d372bd8d14b38546c281f6ee40cb
Signed-off-by: Amol Kahat <amolkahat@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Add support for rdo openvswitch layered upgrade special treatment.

The special treatment for openvswitch works on Red Hat. This patch add
RDO support.

We also adjust for the all naming convention of the openvswitch
package.

This was discovered during the related-bug investigation. Note that it
in itself doesn't solve it.

Conflicts:
    tripleo_ansible/ansible_plugins/modules/tripleo_ovs_upgrade.py

Co-Authored-By: yatinkarel <ykarel@redhat.com>
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/761463/
Change-Id: I1986ef8109061dab8213f8ec29160b6d830cdc49
Related-Bug: #1897863
(cherry picked from commit 31ed062a9c1cc2bbccc73ece1ed7307e58b390d1)
(cherry picked from commit c4a181b8558226d41c5d2fa7ceacf7cada16b34c)

messages:
[{'account_id': 11166, 'date': '2019-02-01 22:19:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11166, 'date': '2019-02-01 22:20:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

Needs performance testing and HA testing.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2019-02-02 00:26:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

so one thing about this change is that there is some python-memcache issues when a server fails for memcache. If you have 3 servers and 1 fails, you get like a 10 second timeout penalty on each request. It's actually more ideal to use like localhost on all the systems than configure the complete set of memcache servers.  See https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1634646"}, {'account_id': 11166, 'date': '2019-02-02 11:23:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Yeah, I'll test this and I'll try to figure out how to pair service to some memcached ip. It's not easy as the services using memcached can be on different roles and I have to come up with some mapping. It could end up with just random? Or we should try to fix oslo instead."}, {'account_id': 11166, 'date': '2019-02-02 11:23:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11166, 'date': '2019-02-03 23:25:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2019-02-04 15:14:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

this issue is in python-memcache or whatever. It uses a pool config rather than a proper memcache determination of which server to go look up based on the configuration.  So because it uses a pool instead of hashing the location of the data, when a system goes down it has to hang while trying to connect.'}, {'account_id': 11589, 'date': '2019-02-04 18:58:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11166, 'date': '2019-02-11 11:29:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 11166, 'date': '2019-02-11 12:57:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow-1

Sum of execute time for each test: 12626.4499 sec.'}, {'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2019-02-13 16:02:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2019-02-14 05:39:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2019-02-14 10:26:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

AS I noted before, there is a failover issues for multiple memached servers values. I suggest to point it to localhost for other services but keystone. Won't blocking this tho"}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2019-02-14 10:28:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2019-02-14 10:28:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Bogdan, while I would be really happy to just point it to localhost (since that would be better for security); it seems that other services such as nova are already using memcached... hence why this approach was taken. There is still, of course, the possibility of removing caching from nova and just letting keystone (and middlewares) use it.'}, {'account_id': 11166, 'date': '2019-02-15 15:05:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 11166, 'date': '2019-02-15 15:06:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Workflow-1

Still doing tests on this.'}, {'account_id': 11166, 'date': '2019-02-21 14:23:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 11166, 'date': '2019-02-21 14:25:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Workflow-1

(2 comments)

Another version of patch. By default we should use dogpile.cache.memory and if they want to use memcache than they can enable it by this environment file but they will be warned about the issues with HA.'}, {'account_id': 11816, 'date': '2019-02-21 20:01:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+1

using caching is good.  is there a dogpile issue occurring you need me to look at ?'}, {'account_id': 11166, 'date': '2019-02-22 10:28:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: -Workflow

> using caching is good.  is there a dogpile issue occurring you need
 > me to look at ?

I tried to use dogpile.cache.pylibmc and I hit issue which is probably because we don't do connection pooling. The failure was that it just fails if any of the memcached servers are down even if I passed ketama, remove_failed, dead_failed and retry_timeout options. As python-memcached is dead we should work on switching oslo_cache to pylibmc."}, {'account_id': 11816, 'date': '2019-02-22 14:20:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

> > using caching is good.  is there a dogpile issue occurring you
 > need
 > > me to look at ?
 > 
 > I tried to use dogpile.cache.pylibmc and I hit issue which is
 > probably because we don't do connection pooling. The failure was
 > that it just fails if any of the memcached servers are down even if
 > I passed ketama, remove_failed, dead_failed and retry_timeout
 > options. As python-memcached is dead we should work on switching
 > oslo_cache to pylibmc.

Yah....my involvement w/ dopgile is I do the get/set part :)   Added Morgan Fainberg who had been working on a pymemcache backend and is more up on these topics than me (like, I don't see how pooling being absent would cause it to actually fail)."}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2019-02-22 15:39:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2019-02-22 15:39:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+1

will be back to +2 once the puppet and testing parts got addressed'}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2019-04-22 20:41:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

There is no reason missing pooling should fail unless pylibmc is missing basic functionality. Pymemcache is definitely on the list. We have a potential in-flight patch (actively worked on) ot make the pool use pymemcache. I would advocate for pymemcache over pylibmc. I'll see if I can figure out what the connection pooling and failures for pylibmc are. However, pymemcache is still the best option (long term)."}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2019-06-04 15:05:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2020-03-27 12:57:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

Please note that we have several patches merged in latest puppet-tripleo, which implement caching in authtoken.

Cinder   : https://review.opendev.org/#/c/680845/
Neutron  : https://review.opendev.org/#/c/680852/
Glance   : https://review.opendev.org/#/c/680851/
Heat     : https://review.opendev.org/#/c/680853/
Telemetry: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/681245/
Ironic   : https://review.opendev.org/#/c/680856/
Octavia  : https://review.opendev.org/#/c/680898/
Barbican : https://review.opendev.org/#/c/681371/
Manila   : https://review.opendev.org/#/c/683784/
Designate: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/703399/

These patches generates memcached_servers in puppet-tripleo to follow the way how we generate memcached_servers in nova api and swift.
These changes should be reverted if we implement generation of memcached_servers in t-h-t instead of puppet-tripleo.

(also note we have https://review.opendev.org/#/c/690464/ open, which implements keystone caching at puppet-tripleo layer)'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2020-08-26 22:03:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2020-08-26 22:03:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Published edit on patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2020-08-26 23:00:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review-1

(4 comments)'}, {'account_id': 11166, 'date': '2021-01-05 11:09:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

I suggest abandoning this change, I'll drop it in a week if there is no activity."}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2021-09-14 15:37:57.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Abandoning this patch per the TripleO Patch Abandonment guidelines
(https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/tripleo-specs/specs/policy/patch-abandonment.html).
If you wish to have this restored and cannot do so yourself, please reach out
via #tripleo on OFTC or the OpenStack Dev mailing list.'}]

commit_message:
Add environment enabling memcached for cache and authtoken

If user wants they should be able to enable memcached even if it
can bring stability issues with HA.

Co-Authored-By: Harry Rybacki <hrybacki@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Juan Antonio Osorio Robles <jaosorior@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I081abf37b7d0be954cdb3d75c77a90d75cc50dc0

commit_message:
Configure masquerade networks by ansible

This change replaces previous usage of puppet modules for masquerade
networks by ansible, so that we can maintain all firewall rules by
ansible.

Change-Id: Ied1f6c8537c119a7c022bcd44fb93ff435b9566c

commit_message:
pin container-tools for container builds

the container build check jobs and periodic jobs
do not use the release files in tq.  These jobs
should have container-tools pinned in the same
way as tq to ensure we have a consistent set
of rpms across all environments and jobs.

ref:
ripleo-quickstart/config/release/tripleo-ci/CentOS-8

Change-Id: I03f2f3463b979a6615217637ab4448e57a43f4d6

commit_message:
Use KeystoneRegion to determine location in s3api middleware

The location parameter of s3api middleware should be set to the region
of the Swift cluster so that AWS v4 signature works correctly in S3 API
access.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/768211
Change-Id: I545c2e3727a6dcef0116906ecd7a4bd580807c96

commit_message:
Fix qemu-img installation for Octavia

qemu-img needs to be explicitly installed when running Octavia playbook,
it was previously installed as a dependency in another project, but it's
now missing.

Change-Id: Ie8ee84ef6d935313a00521bb9435c721c36e9678
Closes-Bug: #1906480

commit_message:
Increase update run loss threashold to 30s.

Relax a bit the 0 seconds constraints. We have some false positive
with 1 lost ping. Sometime a bit more. Let's see how it behaves with
30 seconds.

Change-Id: I8f91283987afb4f3b044363817a1e7de331352bc

[{'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2020-09-08 12:33:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2020-09-08 12:34:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 23811, 'date': '2020-09-08 12:43:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2020-09-09 07:30:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2

looks like it does what is says in the commit message :)'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2020-09-09 08:31:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1

what problem does this solve? please link a bug'}, {'account_id': 18575, 'date': '2020-09-09 09:24:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Kernelargs are configured using kernelargs.yaml [1] tasks file, which will be invoked using BootParams TripleO service. Does this require rebuild too (commit msg says kernel parameters)?

[1] https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-ansible/blob/master/tripleo_ansible/roles/tripleo_kernel/tasks/kernelargs.yml'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2020-09-09 10:39:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Workflow-1

Let me hold this patch until I file a bug.

As a background of this change, we use to observe the issue with rpcbind.socket when ipv6 is disabled, and eventually we identified we should rebuild initramfs to make kernel parameters (here I mean what is described in /etc/sysctl.conf and /etc/sysctl.d/*)
I'll try to reproduce the same in my el8 deployment.
 [1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1830574

Honestly I've never experienced the issue caused by other stufffs like packages and kernel modules but these might cause potential issue I think. On the other hand, I'm not so sure about the way how kernelargs so I would we appreciate any suggestions or thoughts about this."}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2020-09-10 06:13:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1

revoting then ...'}, {'account_id': 23811, 'date': '2020-09-11 09:45:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2020-11-24 17:41:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2021-09-14 15:37:18.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

If you wish to have this restored and cannot do so yourself, please reach out
via #tripleo on OFTC or the OpenStack Dev mailing list.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-09-08 12:33:18.000000000', 'message': 'Rebuild initramfs after updating kernel parameters

This patch triggers rebuld of initramfs fs when any kernel parameters
are changed, to make sure that these updated parameters are applied
in initramfs image.

Change-Id: I56599a43e32adfe35133e4b769800d9b08c6c8bd
'}, {'created': '2020-09-08 12:34:10.000000000', 'message': 'Rebuild initramfs after updating kernel parameters

This patch triggers rebuld of initramfs when any kernel parameters are
changed, to make sure that these updated parameters are applied in
initramfs image.

Change-Id: I56599a43e32adfe35133e4b769800d9b08c6c8bd
'}, {'created': '2020-09-09 02:09:55.000000000', 'message': 'Rebuild initramfs after updating kernel parameters

This patch triggers rebuld of initramfs when any kernel parameters are
changed, to make sure that these updated parameters are applied in
initramfs image.

Change-Id: I56599a43e32adfe35133e4b769800d9b08c6c8bd
'}, {'created': '2020-09-09 02:12:58.000000000', 'message': 'Rebuild initramfs during kernel configuration

This patch triggers rebuld of initramfs when any configuration related

commit_message:
Rebuild initramfs during kernel configuration

This patch triggers rebuld of initramfs when any configuration related
to kernel(kernel extra packages, kernel modules and kernel parameters)
is changed to make sure that the change is applied in initramfs image.

Change-Id: I56599a43e32adfe35133e4b769800d9b08c6c8bd

      --playbook all \

The run is rather quick has we are not running any include because of

commit_message:
[DNM] Add a workaround to ovn-controller update orchestration issue.

This is an example of how we could do it inside the current framework.

The command to trigger this is:

   openstack overcloud update run --limit Compute \
      --playbook all \
      --tags ovn_controller_container_update

The run is rather quick as we are not running any include because of
the tags.

The never tag makes this tasks ignored during normal update.

DNM: because that may is not the long term solution and a short term
solution may not be required.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/763056
Change-Id: I8f752eca6e00fbdcf9f4de4d40521fd4ae7be841

Let me know if this is reasonable or not.

commit_message:
For linux bonds over VF, the default value of spoofcheck shall be false

In case of mellanox NIC, for linux bonds over VFs we need to disable
spoofchecking. This setting also works well with intel NICs.

Change-Id: I9a553d9963c8b02522040861c489f4523d082b42

Adds a new DockerUnqualifiedSearchAddress parameter for the podman
install. This is passed through to tripleo-ansible to set the
tripleo_podman_unqualified_search_registries. As described in the
related bug, during the minor update we have unqualified pulls
for the pcs containers and that is defaulting to docker.io.

Change-Id: I3b959fda70cd75f5255428a6477de3f194bb49b5
Related-Bug: 1903581
'}]
commit_message:
Adds DockerUnqualifiedSearchAddress to podman parameters

Adds a new DockerUnqualifiedSearchAddress parameter for the podman
install. This is passed through to tripleo-ansible to set the
tripleo_podman_unqualified_search_registries. As described in the
related bug, during the minor update we have unqualified pulls
for the pcs containers and that is defaulting to docker.io.

Change-Id: I3b959fda70cd75f5255428a6477de3f194bb49b5
Related-Bug: 1903581

subject: Don't throw away data in undercloud_service_certificate
messages:
[{'account_id': 23078, 'date': '2020-07-23 20:23:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 23078, 'date': '2020-07-23 20:26:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Note, this potentially okay to merge but I think it needs some discussion.

The way I have implemented this, there is no longer validation of the file contents for undercloud_service_certificate. That's because the cryptography library doesn't have a way to recognize a file containing a chain of certificates.

Some alternatives:
1) add dependency on https://github.com/hynek/pem so that the file can be validated
2) declare that the undercloud can only have a simple cert + key and not cert chain + key; after all, the undercloud endpoints are typically internal only and if there is a cert chain, it's probably a public cert


Thoughts?"}, {'account_id': 23078, 'date': '2020-09-21 13:43:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: -Code-Review

Moving this to the top. Anyone? I'm just looking for initial feedback."}, {'account_id': 9914, 'date': '2020-11-06 16:24:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Sorry for the delay in the review.  Completely slipped off my radar.'}, {'account_id': 23078, 'date': '2020-11-06 16:27:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

Hi Ade -I forgot this review too, so no worries. I am probably going to abandon this patch in favor of documenting a solution that uses CONF.custom_env_files'}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2021-09-14 15:36:47.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Abandoning this patch per the TripleO Patch Abandonment guidelines
(https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/tripleo-specs/specs/policy/patch-abandonment.html).
If you wish to have this restored and cannot do so yourself, please reach out
via #tripleo on OFTC or the OpenStack Dev mailing list.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-07-23 20:23:37.000000000', 'message': "Don't throw away data in undercloud_service_certificate

undercloud_service_certificate (and minion_service_certificate) are meant to
reference a file containing a certificate and private key. Sometimes that
certificate is actually a certificae chain, so we need to ensure that we
don't throw away the intermediate certificates in that case. In other words,
the undercloud ought to have an equivalent to the overcloud's
SSLIntermediateCertificate paramter.

Note that this patch necessarily removes some logic which splits up a file only
to have it be put back together again.

Change-Id: I5907ba92d7cda92f2692e1f3d5bc0ab7ccc5b34a
Closes-Bug: 1882594
"}]
commit_message:
Don't throw away data in undercloud_service_certificate

undercloud_service_certificate (and minion_service_certificate) are meant to
reference a file containing a certificate and private key. Sometimes that
certificate is actually a certificae chain, so we need to ensure that we
don't throw away the intermediate certificates in that case. In other words,
the undercloud ought to have an equivalent to the overcloud's
SSLIntermediateCertificate paramter.

Note that this patch necessarily removes some logic which splits up a file only
to have it be put back together again.

Change-Id: I5907ba92d7cda92f2692e1f3d5bc0ab7ccc5b34a
Closes-Bug: 1882594

commit_message:
content-provider jobs use tripleo-ci post.yaml, collect container builds

container check jobs use tripleo-buildcontainers/post.yaml
and we capture the container build info and
roles/build-containers/tasks/post.yaml

content-provider jobs are parented off of standalone
and use tripleo-ci default post.yaml
playbooks/tripleo-ci/post.yaml

This calls ansible-role-collect-logs. The config
for collect logs does not include the kolla
and tcip container build dirs making it difficult
to debug.

Change-Id: I16785bd4c01e6b4a3c71318721dfacbf2f726016

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated

Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without

Change-Id: I09b11ddd1b022b9e86d6671c90186d3312469153
"}]
commit_message:
setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: I09b11ddd1b022b9e86d6671c90186d3312469153

commit_message:
Update parameters for authtoken middleware

... to avoid warnings from the middleware about deprecated parameters.
Currently parameters of each auth plugin are not loaded in unit tests
so user credentials are not updated but just removed.

Change-Id: I6e420dac51ac8cf92eadb1c3a3d4716a96c22001

commit_message:
Hitachi: Add generic volume groups

This patch adds consistency group capability as generic volume groups
for the Hitachi driver.

DocImpact
Implements: blueprint hitachi-vsp-add-consistency-groups

Change-Id: I101d6899c8e7d4911c64cded2c10da68f5bceed2

https://www.haproxy.com/blog/haproxy-2-1/#deprecated-configuration-options

Tested this by deploying an overcloud with tls-e and this patch and

because I think that it is just broken with tls-e even before this
patch. Both before / after this patch (and with different haproxy
versions) return the following on tls-e:

curl: (52) Empty reply from server

and haproxy returns:
Sep 10 10:47:21 controller-1 haproxy[7]: 10.0.0.254:41052 [10/Sep/2021:10:47:21.386] cinder/1: SSL handshake failure

Closes-Bug: #1942675

Change-Id: Ie29a03affbbf8d6d47a5c50ef1c17bab9847f460

commit_message:
Replace rsprep directive with http-response replace-header

Haproxy 2.4.x errors out when using rsprep directive:
<13>Sep  4 08:07:09 puppet-user: [NOTICE] (34) : path to executable is /usr/sbin/haproxy
<13>Sep  4 08:07:09 puppet-user: [ALERT]  (34) : parsing [/etc/haproxy/haproxy.cfg20210904-13-18ckjh5:44] : The 'rsprep' directive is not supported anymore since HAProxy 2.1. Use 'http-response replace-header' instead.
<13>Sep  4 08:07:09 puppet-user: [ALERT]  (34) : parsing [/etc/haproxy/haproxy.cfg20210904-13-18ckjh5:58] : The 'rsprep' directive is not supported anymore since HAProxy 2.1. Use 'http-response replace-header' instead.
<13>Sep  4 08:07:09 puppet-user: [ALERT]  (34) : parsing [/etc/haproxy/haproxy.cfg20210904-13-18ckjh5:81] : The 'rsprep' directive is not supported

Tested with haproxy 2.4 and now the config is accepted by haproxy -c.
The rsprep directive has been removed in 2.1:
https://www.haproxy.com/blog/haproxy-2-1/#deprecated-configuration-options

Tested this by deploying an overcloud with tls-e and this patch and
verifying that tempest still works.

The config lines now look like the following:

  http-response replace-header Location http://(.*) https://\1
  http-response replace-header Location http://10.0.0.5(.*) https://10.0.0.5\1

Tested the horizon redirect is still working:
[stack@undercloud-0 ~]$ curl -v -L http://overcloud.localdomain:80/
*   Trying 10.0.0.5:80...
* Connected to overcloud.localdomain (10.0.0.5) port 80 (#0)
> GET / HTTP/1.1
> Host: overcloud.localdomain
> User-Agent: curl/7.76.1
> Accept: */*
>
* Mark bundle as not supporting multiuse
< HTTP/1.1 301 Moved Permanently
< content-length: 0
< location: https://overcloud.localdomain/

Closes-Bug: #1942675

Change-Id: Ie29a03affbbf8d6d47a5c50ef1c17bab9847f460

commit_message:
Fix sqlalchemy

Inplicit execution was deprecated in SQLAlhcemy, version 1.4 doesn't
support and we need to convert to explicit[1]

[1] https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/14/changelog/migration_20.html#implicit-and-connectionless-execution-bound-metadata-removed

Change-Id: I4a780567fb92c32cf55c54e2e134df9456e36165

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 27419, 'date': '2021-06-25 17:42:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 27419, 'date': '2021-06-25 17:42:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(8 comments)'}, {'account_id': 27419, 'date': '2021-06-29 14:00:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(8 comments)

James, thanks for the in-depth review.

I believe one of the biggest irritant addressed with the decontainerization is that we remove one point of failure from one of the most crucial aspect of deployments. From the compute perspective, the virtualization of libvirt/virtlog are probably the components that had their fair share of issues, as well as some of the most critical ones.'}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2021-06-30 19:07:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 27419, 'date': '2021-07-01 23:24:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 27419, 'date': '2021-07-05 14:19:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 27419, 'date': '2021-07-05 14:20:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2021-07-06 18:34:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2021-07-12 15:01:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 27419, 'date': '2021-07-14 16:19:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

I just want to add here that centos-9 uses cgroups-v2 as opposed to cgroups-v1 in centos-8. This is causing issues right now with the various wrappers we have in neutron and nova [1] as well as nova_libvirt. Decontainerizing libvirt wouldn't necessary help at this point, we'd have to validate.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1936005"}, {'account_id': 27419, 'date': '2021-09-14 14:22:00.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Abandonning for now as we are going to need libvirt containerized for openshift operator.'}]

commit_message:
Xena project personas for volume type access API

Implements the 3 Xena personas (no system scope).  Also introduces
a new policy 'volume_extension:volume_type_access:get_all_for_type'
that governs the GET /types/{type_id}/os-volume-type-access call.

Also removes an overriding policy definition from policy.yaml in
cinder/tests/unit/ that doesn't appear to be needed.

Co-authored-by: Lance Bragstad <lbragstad@gmail.com>
Co-authored-by: Brian Rosmaita <rosmaita.fossdev@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I6db266315efa02f08dfc0c069514f2ff9b8c551e

[{'created': '2021-09-10 09:45:59.000000000', 'message': 'CI: Fix get_logs.sh docker logs output

Currently the logs get printed in Zuul job stdout and only a small portion
of them is redirected to a file - this patch changes that to send all output
to desired files.

commit_message:
CI: Fix get_logs.sh docker logs output

Currently the logs get printed in Zuul job stdout and only a small portion
of them is redirected to a file - this patch changes that to send all output
to desired files.

Change-Id: I45e937ec7c102e89edee20679b8959bf7f6c7152
(cherry picked from commit 923813ac4820044723814b777e4a39cb6eb273fe)

commit_message:
Remove support for iSCSI deploy from the DIB builder

... but keep support for iscsistart used by iBFT.

Change-Id: I8e892b505d39197dbfffc8d47408b4747679cc85

commit_message:
Remove periodic docker publish job

Has been decided that we no longer need to publish docker image base on train every day

Change-Id: I5d95763c3c28d8303ad19898e985ea89dab6fb76

commit_message:
Sync release-tools and fix Zaza expectations

Sync release-tools in order to fix
ResolutionImpossible on tox invocation. See:
* https://github.com/openstack-charmers/release-tools/issues/151
* https://github.com/openstack-charmers/release-tools/pull/152

Fix Zaza's expected application status after
https://github.com/openstack-charmers/zaza/pull/451

Change-Id: Iaf9602da779fb8a3c408d97675f6767acc0dff13

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-04-19 16:57:34.000000000', 'message': "db: Add initial alembic migration

Re-implement the current base migration from sqlalchemy-migrate in
alembic. This is almost identical, with the main changes being that
everything is handled via alembic-provided APIs (e.g. 'create_table')
rather than APIs that are monkey patched onto sqlalchemy resource
classes by sqlalchemy-migrate (e.g. 'Table.create').

For now, none of cinder's machinery actually uses this. In a future
change, we will start using this instead of the sqlalchemy-migrate
migrations for new deployments dummy apply this and simply dummy apply
it for existing deployments.

This new migration can be compared to legacy migrations using a similar
technique to that described at [1]. Unlike that example, we don't have
different versions of sqlalchemy-migrate migrations to compare here but
rather two totally different sets of migrations. As such, some tweaks
are needed. Consider the below connection string, which indicates we'll
work with an SQLite database:

  DB_URL=sqlite:///cinder.db

The sqlalchemy-migrate-based migrations can be applied using either the
'migrate' utility or the 'manage.py' script provided in the legacy
migrations directory ('cinder/db/sqlalchemy/legacy_migrations'). We'll
use the former:

  $ cd cinder/db/sqlalchemy/legacy_migrations
  $ migrate version_control --url $DB_URL --repository . --version 134
  $ migrate upgrade --url $DB_URL --repository . 135

(note: we're only applying the initial migration since other migrations
are squashed in in a later patch)

We could presumably write a 'manage.py' equivalent for alembic but we
won't do so here, instead using the 'alembic' utility. This utility
doesn't appear to provide an easy way to override arbitrary config
options from the CLI, which means you must modify the 'alembic.ini'
configuration file provided in the root of the migrations repo before
running 'alembic':

  $ cd cinder/db/sqlalchemy/migrations
  $ crudini --set alembic.ini alembic sqlalchemy.url $DB_URL
  $ alembic upgrade head

With this completed, you can compare the two databases. For this SQLite
example, we use the 'sqldiff' utility from the SQLite contributors [2]
(available as part of 'sqlite-tools' on Fedora):

  $ cd cinder/db/sqlalchemy
  $ sqldiff --schema ../legacy_migrations/cinder.db cinder.db
  CREATE TABLE alembic_version (
          version_num VARCHAR(32) NOT NULL,
          CONSTRAINT alembic_version_pkc PRIMARY KEY (version_num)
  );
  DROP TABLE migrate_version;

From this we can see that we've added a new 'alembic_version' table and
dropped the legacy 'migrate_version'. If we dropped the '--schema' flag
from the command then we'd also see some timestamp differences for the
default entries in some tables, but no more.

[1] https://that.guru/blog/comparing-nova-db-migrations/
[2] https://sqlite.org/sqldiff.html

Change-Id: I3f24313b5260a728dc98d47143ce83dba221c257
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
db: Add initial alembic migration

Re-implement the current base migration from sqlalchemy-migrate in
alembic. This is almost identical, with the main changes being that
everything is handled via alembic-provided APIs (e.g. 'create_table')
rather than APIs that are monkey patched onto sqlalchemy resource
classes by sqlalchemy-migrate (e.g. 'Table.create'). Reviewers are
encouraged to diff the old migration file,
'cinder/db/migrations/versions/921e1a36b076_initial.py', against the new
one, 'cinder/db/legacy_migrations/versions/135_cinder_init.py'.

For now, none of cinder's machinery actually uses this. In a future
change, we will start using this instead of the sqlalchemy-migrate
migrations for new deployments dummy apply this and simply dummy apply
it for existing deployments.

This new migration can be compared to legacy migrations using a similar
technique to that described at [1]. Unlike that example, we don't have
different versions of sqlalchemy-migrate migrations to compare here but
rather two totally different sets of migrations. As such, some tweaks
are needed. Consider the below connection string, which indicates we'll
work with an SQLite database:

  DB_URL=sqlite:///cinder.db

The sqlalchemy-migrate-based migrations can be applied using either the
'migrate' utility or the 'manage.py' script provided in the legacy
migrations directory ('cinder/db/sqlalchemy/legacy_migrations'). We'll
use the former:

  $ cd cinder/db/sqlalchemy/legacy_migrations
  $ migrate version_control --url $DB_URL --repository . --version 134
  $ migrate upgrade --url $DB_URL --repository . 135

(note: we're only applying the initial migration since other migrations
are squashed in in a later patch)

We could presumably write a 'manage.py' equivalent for alembic but we
won't do so here, instead using the 'alembic' utility. This utility
doesn't appear to provide an easy way to override arbitrary config
options from the CLI, which means you must modify the 'alembic.ini'
configuration file provided in the root of the migrations repo before
running 'alembic':

  $ cd cinder/db/sqlalchemy/migrations
  $ crudini --set alembic.ini alembic sqlalchemy.url $DB_URL
  $ alembic upgrade head

With this completed, you can compare the two databases. For this SQLite
example, we use the 'sqldiff' utility from the SQLite contributors [2]
(available as part of 'sqlite-tools' on Fedora):

  $ cd cinder/db/sqlalchemy
  $ sqldiff --schema ../legacy_migrations/cinder.db cinder.db
  CREATE TABLE alembic_version (
          version_num VARCHAR(32) NOT NULL,
          CONSTRAINT alembic_version_pkc PRIMARY KEY (version_num)
  );
  DROP TABLE migrate_version;

From this we can see that we've added a new 'alembic_version' table and
dropped the legacy 'migrate_version'. If we dropped the '--schema' flag
from the command then we'd also see some timestamp differences for the
default entries in some tables, but no more.

[1] https://that.guru/blog/comparing-nova-db-migrations/
[2] https://sqlite.org/sqldiff.html

Change-Id: I3f24313b5260a728dc98d47143ce83dba221c257
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Address release note nits for cpu-resources series

Expand upon the existing release note by noting the change in behavior
for the '[compute] cpu_shared_set' option and the 'isolate' CPU thread
policy.

Change-Id: Ie551aed55b41b7c07856038cd044b05004b79182
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
guestfs: With libguestfs >= v1.41.1 decode returned bytes to string

libguestfs >= v1.41.1 and commit 0ee02e0117527 changed the return type
of read_file from string to bytes.

https://github.com/libguestfs/libguestfs/commit/0ee02e0117527b86a31b2a88a14994ce7f15571f

As we don't check the version of libguestfs installed this change
handles both the original behaviour where a string is returned and the
newer behaviour by decoding any returned bytes to a string.

NOTE(lyarwood): As stable/train is supported on both py2 and py3 the use
of six.PY2 has been introduced to avoid the isinstance conditional
incorrectly passing as bytes was an alias to str in py2.

Closes-Bug: #1882421
Change-Id: I1c12b2903c1e5bf3a88394493456ad33233f3cd8
(cherry picked from commit 606d588e3eca1d88ad26b4c2cfa3f2e1d5ed553e)
(cherry picked from commit e98935f705a931e3ae666820387a419be1622b64)
(cherry picked from commit 210abc09b857880aa7665fb540f46cb53662a600)
(cherry picked from commit 637402eec7f3f7f552bfc30d16c5960e3a651395)

commit_message:
Fix get information about multiple VNF instances

When getting information about multiple VNF instances with invalid
attribute selector or invalid attribute-based filtering parameters,
tacker return a response with HTTP Code 200 and all information
about VNF instances. However, according to the specification file,
the HTTP code 400 Bad Request shall be returned.

To fix this bug, this patch adds a new check for this api`s
parameters. If it contains unsupported parameters, the HTTP code
400 Bad Request will be returned.

Closes-Bug: #1938108
Change-Id: I3cca6d6fa664dd8f88791516042892369e4972a2

commit_message:
Use oslo_utils.uuidutils to manipulate UUID Strings: Part 1

This change replaces direct usage of uuid library with uuidutils from
oslo_utils, to reuse the common implementation shared among OpenStack
projects.
This change only updates core codes, and remaining usage in driver
codes will be updated by the subsequent change.

Change-Id: I70c006f1e5fa42c79332897cca46432826dc8a2b

commit_message:
Support creating roles and assigning to service users

This allows creation of custom roles and assigning roles to service
users. This can be useful when policy has been customised.

Change-Id: If6678883b6cb65e628a4cca948a93674d251446c

commit_message:
Allow purging policy files

This change introduces the new purge_config parameter to the policy
class so that any policy rules not managed by puppet manifests can be
cleared.

commit_message:
Delete SG log entries when SG is deleted

When security group is deleted, log entries configured for that SG
weren't removed and stayed in the DB as orphaned entries.
That patch fixes that by subscribe logapi service plugin to the
AFTER_DELETE security group events.

Closes-bug: #1939558
Change-Id: Ibffbbd3b529c31372715d9a064f7cb6bada8c424

commit_message:
Add extension fwaas_v2 based on neutron-api relation data

fwaas_v2 extension is added in l3_agent.ini by default from stein.
However with the newly introduced neutron-api configuration parameter
enable-fwaas, the extension have to added only when it is set to true
on neutron-api charm.

neutron-api charm adds enabled-fwaas as relation data in the commit
https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/charm-neutron-api/+/806676.
This patch removes special handling of fwaas_v2 as l3_extension_plugins
is already updated in relation data based on neutron-api enable-fwaas
configuration.

Remove python3-neutron-fwaas in package list from stein release. The
package is already part of dependency of neutron-l3-agent until Ussuri
release and the dependency will be removed from Victoria release in
package control files.

Synced charmhelpers to get related changes
https://github.com/juju/charm-helpers/pull/640

Partial-Bug: #1934129
Change-Id: I07db7fb7c2f00eaf4c0a5bcc082c73922b87d1c0
(cherry pick from commit de22d6cbe2d9755048019674b8be1a4d11280649)

Change-Id: I1ec6323e5ca317a1b28ecf67f4758d7553762fac

commit_message:
Add extension fwaas_v2 based on neutron-api relation data

fwaas_v2 extension is added in l3_agent.ini by default from stein.
However with the newly introduced neutron-api configuration parameter
enable-fwaas, the extension have to added only when it is set to true
on neutron-api charm.

Add extension fwaas_v2 based on neutron-api relation data

fwaas_v2 extension is added in l3_agent.ini by default from stein.
However with the newly introduced neutron-api configuration parameter
enable-fwaas, the extension have to added only when it is set to true
on neutron-api charm.

configuration.

[{'created': '2021-09-13 16:06:26.000000000', 'message': 'Guarantee that ovn-dbs-pcmk update_tasks are run when the cluster is up

On particular role compositions, the code joining the update_tasks might order
things differently then on a typical 3ctrl control plane and the ovn-dbs tasks
at step1 (which require the cluster to be up) will happen after the pacemaker
task at step1 which stops the cluster.

So we can observe something like the following:

2021-09-10 10:05:18.569161 | 001c2891-506d-f833-ff5a-000000000958 | TASK | Start pacemaker cluster
2021-09-10 10:05:18.627924 | 001c2891-506d-f833-ff5a-000000000958 | SKIPPED | Start pacemaker cluster | ovn-db-01
2021-09-10 10:05:18.628678 | 001c2891-506d-f833-ff5a-000000000958 | TIMING | Start pacemaker cluster | ovn-db-01 | 0:00:59.299453 | 0.06s
2021-09-10 10:05:18.637292 | 001c2891-506d-f833-ff5a-000000000959 | TASK | Release the cluster shutdown lock
2021-09-10 10:05:18.694945 | 001c2891-506d-f833-ff5a-000000000959 | SKIPPED | Release the cluster shutdown lock | ovn-db-01
2021-09-10 10:05:18.695717 | 001c2891-506d-f833-ff5a-000000000959 | TIMING | Release the cluster shutdown lock | ovn-db-01 | 0:00:59.366493 | 0.06s
2021-09-10 10:05:18.704368 | 001c2891-506d-f833-ff5a-00000000095a | TASK | Clear ovndb cluster pacemaker error
2021-09-10 10:05:19.368816 | 001c2891-506d-f833-ff5a-00000000095a | FATAL | Clear ovndb cluster pacemaker error | ovn-db-01 | error={"changed": true, "cmd": "pcs resource cleanup ovn-dbs-bundle", "delta": "0:00:00.399084", "end": "2021-09-10 10:05:20
.044985", "msg": "non-zero return code", "rc": 1, "start": "2021-09-10 10:05:19.645901", "stderr": "Error: Unable to forget failed operations of resource: ovn-dbs-bundle\nError connecting to the CIB manager: Transport endpoint is not connected\nError perf
orming operation: Transport endpoint is not connected", "stderr_lines": ["Error: Unable to forget failed operations of resource: ovn-dbs-bundle", "Error connecting to the CIB manager: Transport endpoint is not connected", "Error performing operation: Tran
sport endpoint is not connected"], "stdout": "", "stdout_lines": []}

We cannot call pcs resource cleanup at step1, we must call it at step0 so we're
guaranteed that the cluster is up, no matter how heat/ansible decide to order
the update_tasks.

should be around verifying that we can now remove those workarounds
that were implemented for OVN bugs.

commit_message:
Guarantee that ovn-dbs-pcmk update_tasks are run when the cluster is up

On particular role compositions, the code joining the update_tasks might order
things differently then on a typical 3ctrl control plane and the ovn-dbs tasks
at step1 (which require the cluster to be up) will happen after the pacemaker
task at step1 which stops the cluster.

So we can observe something like the following:
2021-09-10 10:05:13.370339 | 001c2891-506d-f833-ff5a-000000000954 | TASK | Change the bundle operation timeout
2021-09-10 10:05:14.136798 | 001c2891-506d-f833-ff5a-000000000954 | CHANGED | Change the bundle operation timeout | ovn-db-01
2021-09-10 10:05:14.137982 | 001c2891-506d-f833-ff5a-000000000954 | TIMING | Change the bundle operation timeout | ovn-db-01 | 0:00:54.808754 | 0.77s
2021-09-10 10:05:14.146853 | 001c2891-506d-f833-ff5a-000000000956 | TASK | Acquire the cluster shutdown lock to stop pacemaker cluster
2021-09-10 10:05:14.508085 | 001c2891-506d-f833-ff5a-000000000956 | CHANGED | Acquire the cluster shutdown lock to stop pacemaker cluster | ovn-db-01
2021-09-10 10:05:14.509257 | 001c2891-506d-f833-ff5a-000000000956 | TIMING | Acquire the cluster shutdown lock to stop pacemaker cluster | ovn-db-01 | 0:00:55.180032 | 0.36s
2021-09-10 10:05:14.518668 | 001c2891-506d-f833-ff5a-000000000957 | TASK | Stop pacemaker cluster
2021-09-10 10:05:18.559627 | 001c2891-506d-f833-ff5a-000000000957 | CHANGED | Stop pacemaker cluster | ovn-db-01

2021-09-10 10:05:18.560561 | 001c2891-506d-f833-ff5a-000000000957 | TIMING | Stop pacemaker cluster | ovn-db-01 | 0:00:59.231336 | 4.04s
2021-09-10 10:05:18.569161 | 001c2891-506d-f833-ff5a-000000000958 | TASK | Start pacemaker cluster
2021-09-10 10:05:18.627924 | 001c2891-506d-f833-ff5a-000000000958 | SKIPPED | Start pacemaker cluster | ovn-db-01
2021-09-10 10:05:18.628678 | 001c2891-506d-f833-ff5a-000000000958 | TIMING | Start pacemaker cluster | ovn-db-01 | 0:00:59.299453 | 0.06s
2021-09-10 10:05:18.637292 | 001c2891-506d-f833-ff5a-000000000959 | TASK | Release the cluster shutdown lock
2021-09-10 10:05:18.694945 | 001c2891-506d-f833-ff5a-000000000959 | SKIPPED | Release the cluster shutdown lock | ovn-db-01
2021-09-10 10:05:18.695717 | 001c2891-506d-f833-ff5a-000000000959 | TIMING | Release the cluster shutdown lock | ovn-db-01 | 0:00:59.366493 | 0.06s
2021-09-10 10:05:18.704368 | 001c2891-506d-f833-ff5a-00000000095a | TASK | Clear ovndb cluster pacemaker error
2021-09-10 10:05:19.368816 | 001c2891-506d-f833-ff5a-00000000095a | FATAL | Clear ovndb cluster pacemaker error | ovn-db-01 | error={"changed": true, "cmd": "pcs resource cleanup ovn-dbs-bundle", "delta": "0:00:00.399084", "end": "2021-09-10 10:05:20
.044985", "msg": "non-zero return code", "rc": 1, "start": "2021-09-10 10:05:19.645901", "stderr": "Error: Unable to forget failed operations of resource: ovn-dbs-bundle\nError connecting to the CIB manager: Transport endpoint is not connected\nError perf
orming operation: Transport endpoint is not connected", "stderr_lines": ["Error: Unable to forget failed operations of resource: ovn-dbs-bundle", "Error connecting to the CIB manager: Transport endpoint is not connected", "Error performing operation: Tran
sport endpoint is not connected"], "stdout": "", "stdout_lines": []}

We cannot call pcs resource cleanup at step1, we must call it at step0 so we're
guaranteed that the cluster is up, no matter how heat/ansible decide to order
the update_tasks.

Note: This is the short-term less-invasive fix. The mid-long term fix
should be around verifying that we can now remove those workarounds
that were implemented for OVN bugs.

Closes-Bug: #1943254
Change-Id: Idd827f72c0033978db7b9a8ea6acec2086cda961
(cherry picked from commit ff3173bdcf304dc726f5b03d813fa2194e2c63cc)

messages:

commit_message:
Fix hostmonitor to respect quorum

Both cibadmin-based and crm_mon-based host status queryings were
affected, allowing partitioned cluster to tell Masakari to
evacuate hosts from the other partition (which nota bene include
all remotes if applicable).

Closes-Bug: #1878548
Change-Id: I0b1ca8a011ee4da162a2c3a986c1dab9a3d38190

commit_message:
Do not hard-code overcloud-full image name

The var overcloud_image defaults to overcloud-full, and will until the
switchover to the whole-disk overcloud.

Change-Id: I64c0d9f97b34e9145be70af7c489bb5b706baf8a
Blueprint: whole-disk-default

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-07 12:45:44.000000000', 'message': 'Add more retries to TestMigrateFromDownHost tests

We still having occasional failures in TestMigrateFromDownHost tests
where the compute is not observed down after stopping the service. There
was a fix I61fded6f513c18dbd0248ed54fc58a318dc05416 that increased the
CONF.service_down_time to 6 seconds. However the
_wait_for_service_parameter() helper by default uses 10 retries with 0.5
sec delays. This can be pretty close to the 6 seconds of service
timeout. This patch increase the number of retires to 20 avoid unstable
test runs.

Change-Id: Iad970fa3aa10aaa2c831a064c085c06fdc88305e
Closes-Bug: #1940741
'}]
commit_message:
Add more retries to TestMigrateFromDownHost tests

We still having occasional failures in TestMigrateFromDownHost tests
where the compute is not observed down after stopping the service. There
was a fix I61fded6f513c18dbd0248ed54fc58a318dc05416 that increased the
CONF.service_down_time to 6 seconds. However the
_wait_for_service_parameter() helper by default uses 10 retries with 0.5
sec delays. This can be pretty close to the 6 seconds of service
timeout. This patch increase the number of retires to 20 avoid unstable
test runs.

Change-Id: Iad970fa3aa10aaa2c831a064c085c06fdc88305e
Closes-Bug: #1940741

commit_message:
Splits the `TestBaremetalProxy` class

Nine new classes `TestDrivers`, `TestChassis`, `TestNode`, `TestPort`, `TestPortGroups`, `TestAllocation`, `TestVolumeConnector`, `TestVolumeTarget`, and `TestMisc` are created. They contain all the tests previously embedded in `TestBaremetalProxy`.

In `TestBaremetalProxy`, only the `setUp` method remains

Change-Id: I055d571ac3b179679c58c1cddc86abc9fe63f5aa

commit_message:
Glance remote worker should use own cache directory

Earlier glance remote worker was using same cache directory used by
glance worker. Ideally both should use their own cache directory.

This patch makes provision for the same by setting different path
for image_cache_dir config option.

Change-Id: If2627e9c212fd765b96d925046c04e9cb1001c3d

commit_message:
Splits class `TestInstanceHaProxy`

Three new classes `TestInstanceHaHosts`, `TestInstanceHaNotifications`, and `TestInstanceHaSegments` are created. They contain all the tests previously embedded in `TestInstanceHaProxy`.

In `TestInstanceHaProxy`, only the `setUp` method remains

commit_message:
Add ovmf package for uefi support

When creating an instance with uefi support it is looking for various
files that are typically provided by ovmf package. This is automatically
installed from train and above, but is lacking in queens. This will
solve it for any deployment.

Change-Id: I7665a596112d673624ea5edd7438b915834918df

This commit removes the following deprecated projects:

- monasca-log-api [1]
- monasca-transform [2]
- os-xenapi. This project is still supported by Nova, but it is no
  longer supported in Neutron and we are explicitly patching it out in
  Nova unit tests.
- oslosphinx. There are some old projects still requiring it, but we are
  patching them out.
- python-glareclient. While not officially abandoned, it has not been
  updated for several years, and no other package requires it.

[2] - https://opendev.org/openstack/monasca-transform/src/branch/master/README.rst

commit_message:
Cleanup deprecated projects

This commit removes the following deprecated projects:

- monasca-log-api [1]
- monasca-transform [2]
- os-xenapi. This project is still supported by Nova, but it is no
  longer supported in Neutron and we are explicitly patching it out in
  Nova unit tests.
- oslosphinx. There are some old projects still requiring it, but we are
  patching them out.
- python-glareclient. While not officially abandoned, it has not been
  updated for several years, and no other package requires it.

[1] - https://opendev.org/openstack/monasca-log-api/src/branch/master/README.rst
[2] - https://opendev.org/openstack/monasca-transform/src/branch/master/README.rst

Change-Id: I62d960b47a9e65c595a587c8d832e8b1bd5cc748

commit_message:
Update master for stable/xena

stable/xena.

automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/xena.

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/xena

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/xena branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I579aefaef286970e3dcaffedc7942521c192ee06

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-09 13:13:26.000000000', 'message': "[Functional] Wait for the initial state of ha router before test

In functional tests of the HA and DVR HA routers, when e.g.
failover is tested, we should always wait for routers to be in the
expected initial state (primary or backup) before router failover
will actually be done.
Without that, we may hit race condition when initial router's state
is enqueued but not processed yet and then state will be changed thus
no any action will be performed by L3 agent and test may fail.

Closes-Bug: #1939507
Change-Id: Ibd8f78fc822b04965c6a79b57b13be364934f64f
"}]
commit_message:
[Functional] Wait for the initial state of ha router before test

In functional tests of the HA and DVR HA routers, when e.g.
failover is tested, we should always wait for routers to be in the
expected initial state (primary or backup) before router failover
will actually be done.
Without that, we may hit race condition when initial router's state
is enqueued but not processed yet and then state will be changed thus
no any action will be performed by L3 agent and test may fail.

Closes-Bug: #1939507
Change-Id: Ibd8f78fc822b04965c6a79b57b13be364934f64f

We have a requirement to point the "notifications" of the core component service to other rabbitmq clusters. So I used murano's outward_rabbitmq and "notifications" to be integrated together, and it is running in our environment.

commit_message:
Detect outward-rabbitmq and rabbitmq group overlaps

When the containers of groups['outward-rabbitmq'] and groups['rabbitmq']
are on the same physical machine, subsequent start of outward_rabbitmq of
groups['outward-rabbitmq'] will start to report an error. So add precheck
task to avoid this situation

Change-Id: I20056f511e95d217e926a59b8bc974d7cedeae73

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I8304dfc005aae8472bce33591eade572136e7acc

commit_message:
Add CephRbdTrashPurgeInterval parameter

When ceph is deployed via TripleO, during the overcloud deployment
phase the tripleo_cephadm role is able to add a new trash purge
scheduler. This change exposes the tripleo CephRbdTrashPurgeInterval
which defines the interval that will be applied to the scheduler.

Depends-On: Ide51ba4cef7c9f0df78d505f7429745285d7d484
Change-Id: I6d560bbd67958ec484248ad0b20ef30f1f9593b8
(cherry picked from commit fcfa8ac23ba0b9c2900a16de981da68ab9221619)

subject: Make "killed" images list available using the CLI
messages:
[{'account_id': 33786, 'date': '2021-08-26 10:28:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 33786, 'date': '2021-09-02 08:58:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 33786, 'date': '2021-09-02 09:03:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 33786, 'date': '2021-09-03 01:48:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 33786, 'date': '2021-09-07 08:30:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5: New patch set was added with same tree, parent, and commit message as Patch Set 4.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2021-09-08 17:23:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

I think killed status is just a thing in v1, which is long since gone right? Not sure it makes sense to bring killed forward to v2 just because of the potential to clean up old images.

Maybe we need a glance-manage command to clean old killed images from the DB and a reno to tell operators to do that thing at some point?'}, {'account_id': 33786, 'date': '2021-09-10 08:38:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

> Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1
> 
> (1 comment)
> 
> I think killed status is just a thing in v1, which is long since gone right? Not sure it makes sense to bring killed forward to v2 just because of the potential to clean up old images.

It is true that the killed status occurs infrequently now. But, the question that image in killed status coun't be list was still being reported in the ussuri in april this year. 

In fact, some people still experience the killed status. The "list" command is set to list "all of image" and this patch does not affect other logic. So, mabye this patch could be recognizeded by you？


> Maybe we need a glance-manage command to clean old killed images from the DB and a reno to tell operators to do that thing at some point?

I'm agree with you. If it could be make sure, should we can report a bug or blueprint? I can be responsible for making it happen.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2021-09-10 13:32:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

> It is true that the killed status occurs infrequently now. But, the question that image in killed status coun't be list was still being reported in the ussuri in april this year. 

This should be the only way to get into killed state anymore, and this patch will fix it so it doesn't happen anymore:

https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/glance/+/807932

> In fact, some people still experience the killed status. The "list" command is set to list "all of image" and this patch does not affect other logic. So, mabye this patch could be recognizeded by you？

As documented here, killed state should only be a thing in v1:

https://docs.openstack.org/glance/wallaby/user/statuses.html

If we show images in that state in v2, we need to change that graph and probably handle it in a lot of other places. The correct thing to do is to eliminate the remaining accidental transition (so images can never get into killed state again), and provide a way to clean up those images that are already in the database.

> > Maybe we need a glance-manage command to clean old killed images from the DB and a reno to tell operators to do that thing at some point?
> 
> I'm agree with you. If it could be make sure, should we can report a bug or blueprint? I can be responsible for making it happen.

I think that a bug would be suitable for this, but yes, please file one at least. Abhi could decide that a blueprint is *also* needed, but I would expect just a but would be fine.

Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 33786, 'date': '2021-09-13 01:41:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Oh, Thanks you very much for your comments. I get my error. Yes, the good way is don't make a image into killed state. 

I will report a bug about the glance-manage command which aims to clean old killed images. And I will hard to achive it.

Thanks you again, my friend."}, {'account_id': 33786, 'date': '2021-09-13 06:22:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

[{'created': '2021-08-26 10:28:02.000000000', 'message': 'Make "killed" images list available using the CLI

Images in "killed" status weren't able to list by using
CLI even if using "--property status=killed". Fisrt, It is
not reasonable that the argument "status=killed" could be
accepted but not effective. Besides, when the image_id is
known the details can be shown and they can be deleted. It
also is a contradiction. But if an user can't list "killed"
images, he doesn't know the image_id.

The filtering for the "killed" status was cancelled.

Users can list Images in "killed" status using CLI——
"openstack image list".

Closes-Bug: #1924612

commit_message:
Make "killed" images list available using the CLI

Images in "killed" status weren't able to list by using
CLI even if using "--property status=killed". Fisrt, It is
not reasonable that the argument "status=killed" could be
accepted but not effective. Besides, when the image_id is
known the details can be shown and they can be deleted. It
also is a contradiction. If an user can't list "killed"
images, he doesn't know the image_id.

The filtering for the "killed" status was cancelled.

Users can list Images in "killed" status using CLI——
"openstack image list".

Closes-Bug: #1924612
Change-Id: Icb373fd09ebae32edf6b60e6536562ccb9a1342d

commit_message:
Update master for stable/wallaby

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/wallaby.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/wallaby.

Sem-Ver: feature
Change-Id: I12a97ab09cc76180e9e55db0052c2fe986abeb9d

commit_message:
Add rbd trash purge scheduler to the Ceph conf

This change adds the ability to configure a new rbd
trash purge scheduler passing an interval as parameter.

Change-Id: Ide51ba4cef7c9f0df78d505f7429745285d7d484
(cherry picked from commit dd8ae29ebddd563f9fbcbb53ac90d7c42ef6c89a)

commit_message:
db: Add alembic boilerplate

This is mostly generated using 'alembic init', with some minor changes
to ensure we add a license to generated scripts (to keep hacking happy)
and don't generate a downgrade step (which we don't support).

Change-Id: I9380af78f397c552244d7cac4a8131df1ff65d91
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Implement Xena personas for volume groups

This change starts implementing secure RBAC by adopting common default
roles provided by keystone, namly the reader role for read-only support.

Also removes the following from tests/unit/policy.yaml, which do not
appear to be used anywere, but which interfere with these tests:
-"group:get_all": ""
-"group:get": ""
-"group:update": ""
-"group:delete": ""

Co-Authored-by: Rajat Dhasmana <rajatdhasmana@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-by: Brian Rosmaita <rosmaita.fossdev@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I4216a0c1d562fca1b99027fdd67f8f3aaa134514

commit_message:
Implement project personas for the limits API

This commit ensures both system administrators (e.g., project-admins)
and project users can access the limits API.

Future changes will incorporate full system-scope support when cinder
has the necessary plumbing to support system-scope.

Co-Authored-by: Alan Bishop <abishop@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I77db7bc9e14b4554ce72850ba5065aad0befaa92
