revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-09 00:14:30.000000000', 'message': "Remove setting ACLs during Upgrade

Currently, we are setting file ACLs on /var/lib/neutron as part of
upgrade tasks if there is a neutron user in the system. Since moving to
containerized deployment, we don't have neutron user on the system
anymore. This code was added to resolve issues arising with existing
neutron resources when moving from system services to containerized
services.

This patch is to remove the stale upgrade tasks to remove file ACLs.

Closes-Bug: #1943034

Signed-off-by: Purandhar Sairam Mannidi <pmannidi@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I19f457a99dedfd781bd56987e3fea6626737500d
"}, {'created': '2021-09-09 09:38:45.000000000', 'message': "Remove setting ACLs during Upgrade

Currently, we are setting file ACLs on /var/lib/neutron as part of
upgrade tasks if there is a neutron user in the system. Since moving to
containerized deployment, we don't have neutron user on the system
anymore. This code was added to resolve issues arising with existing
neutron resources when moving from system services to containerized
services.

This patch is to remove the stale upgrade tasks to remove file ACLs.

Closes-Bug: #1943034

Signed-off-by: Purandhar Sairam Mannidi <pmannidi@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I19f457a99dedfd781bd56987e3fea6626737500d
"}]
commit_message:
Remove setting ACLs during Upgrade

Currently, we are setting file ACLs on /var/lib/neutron as part of
upgrade tasks if there is a neutron user in the system. Since moving to
containerized deployment, we don't have neutron user on the system
anymore. This code was added to resolve issues arising with existing
neutron resources when moving from system services to containerized
services.

This patch is to remove the stale upgrade tasks to remove file ACLs.

Closes-Bug: #1943034

Signed-off-by: Purandhar Sairam Mannidi <pmannidi@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I19f457a99dedfd781bd56987e3fea6626737500d

sure the policy file gets purged if the policies hash is empty.

commit_message:
Allow purging policy files

This change introduces the new purge_config parameter to the policy
class so that any policy rules not managed by puppet manifests can be
cleared.

Co-Authored-By: Martin Schuppert <mschuppert@redhat.com>
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/802305

[{'created': '2021-08-02 12:44:05.000000000', 'message': 'Set memcached server list from memcached_node_names

This follows other clustered services (like RabbitMQ) and
uses *_node_names (which contain FQDNs), instead of *_node_ips.

Certificate for Memcached TLS is also created using FQDN.
Because of this, validation failed when using pymemcache.
This patch fixes this issue.

Closes-Bug: #1929574

(cherry picked from commit 49921d57f5753dffe032b9501d1101707ce8cc1e)

commit_message:
Set memcached server list from memcached_node_names

This follows other clustered services (like RabbitMQ) and
uses *_node_names (which contain FQDNs), instead of *_node_ips.

Certificate for Memcached TLS is also created using FQDN.
Because of this, validation failed when using pymemcache.
This patch fixes this issue.

Closes-Bug: #1929574
Change-Id: I9d0ddcc88098a5b891829192f1ce656842d0aa15
(cherry picked from commit 49921d57f5753dffe032b9501d1101707ce8cc1e)

will make the policies more inline with changes across OpenStack to
ensure we handle authorization in a consistent way.

commit_message:
Implement secure RBAC for snapshot actions

This patch updates the policies for snapshot actions to align with
the policy persona matrix established for Xena.

Change-Id: Id739c462ffba60328524b3b0b46bbc0ff3a6e2c2

Thanks for looking at this, Rajat.  The test that creates a volume from a raw image is cinder_tempest_plugin.api.volume.test_create_from_image.VolumeAndVolumeTypeFromImageTest

You can see in the log that it does try to clone a new volume from the one containing the image here:
https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/a1139effc6604079a554f7c37af6b929/log/controller/logs/screen-c-vol.txt#1987-1988

It can't find the volume from the URL in the image location (which is what we expected), but instead of erroring out, it falls back to downloading the image from Glance and adding it to the Cinder image cache, and is able to continue with the workflow in that test, and so test_create_from_image_with_volume_type_image_property passes.

I guess short-term I can make this patch depend on https://review.opendev.org/#/c/755654/ and we can see from the log that Cinder is behaving the way we expect, but it would be good to figure out a way to test this.  We can make tempest use a raw image for its tests, but because of the resiliency built into Cinder, everything will pass just as it does now.  I'm not sure how we'll be able to tell that the optimized workflow is being used instead of the regular one."}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2020-10-30 20:10:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 26537, 'date': '2020-10-30 21:12:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Yes, i suppose the image create of test doesn't create an actual image-volume on the cinder side as I'm unable to find the volume with id 96456ef2-680b-4279-9252-7befd1987a97 from which it should clone

> Patch Set 6:
>

Actually this isn't running this optimization, the log you pointed out is at the beginning of create from image method[1] and the next log after that tells us that cinder was unable to find any image volume associated with the image hence normal image create flow[2]

[1] https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/master/cinder/volume/flows/manager/create_volume.py#L1015-L1018
[2] https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/master/cinder/volume/flows/manager/create_volume.py#L718-L719"}, {'account_id': 32912, 'date': '2021-08-19 04:56:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

- pure-devstack-cinder-tempest-iscsi-aio http://openstack-logs.purestorage.com/36/757936/6/thirdparty-check/pure-devstack-cinder-tempest-iscsi-aio/2e62c03/ : SUCCESS in 2h 07m 57s
- pure-devstack-cinder-tempest-fc-aio http://openstack-logs.purestorage.com/36/757936/6/thirdparty-check/pure-devstack-cinder-tempest-fc-aio/7e2d20d/ : SUCCESS in 1h 15m 59s'}, {'account_id': 27615, 'date': '2021-08-19 14:49:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

I found out the issue, the volume is being created in a different backend i.e. lvmdriver-2[1] and the image-volume exists in backend lvmdriver-1

This seems to make sense since our capacity weigher[2] selected lvmdriver-2 over lvmdriver-1 because the image-volume is already created in lvmdriver-1 (consuming space)

commit_message:
Test glance with cinder backend optimization

Configure a gate job for glance using a cinder glance_store
with cinder configured to clone image data directly in the backend
instead of transferring data through glance.

Change-Id: I8a193b1cd6002e11db78c8eebceaa2fbc86a90bc

commit_message:
Remove support for TSM backup driver

... because it was deprecated during Wallaby[1], and the actual
implementation was already removed from cinder[2].

[1] e242bd747d88ea6a4e77bca7a6f617bbea02b5e4
[2] cddcc6e5073ec891b4d7aa4191fab56a05c74089

Change-Id: I8e2eec077e65fb7fa08f5e034295798c341ed67a

commit_message:
Implement project personas for attachments

This commit converts the policies for attachments to use
default roles from keystone and proper scope types.

Co-Authored-by: Lance Bragstad <lbragstad@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-by: Brian Rosmaita <rosmaita.fossdev@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-by: Alan Bishop <abishop@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I467a74dfe321e61d935e8e101dc23c3fc8d74d19

[{'created': '2020-10-28 18:15:30.000000000', 'message': 'Implement secure RBAC for volume API

The volume API contains system and project-level APIs. This commit
updates the policies to use the new system-scope construct. It also adds
support for a read-only role where applicable.

This is inline with a series of changes across OpenStack to provide more
secure and consistent authroization defaults.

Change-Id: I3357f0fc8631e8c3a77aff4d07cb52190e8eddf5

commit_message:
Implement project personas for volume API

This patch updates project-level volume APIs and add respective tests.
This is inline with a series of changes across OpenStack to provide more
secure and consistent authroization defaults.

Co-Authored-by: Rajat Dhasmana <rajatdhasmana@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I3357f0fc8631e8c3a77aff4d07cb52190e8eddf5

commit_message:
Update project personas for default_types

The default_types policies previously had initial support for system
and project scoped personas. However, cinder won't support scopes in
Xena. The scoping aspects of the default_types policies are removed
until support for scopes is added in Yoga.

Some functional and unit tests are deleted in favor of new tests that
use the secure-rbac test framework.

Co-Authored-by: Rajat Dhasmana <rajatdhasmana@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I9d0a6994d92033539d39a1ce2403c12b69511712

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-28 17:39:00.000000000', 'message': 'Implement secure RBAC for volume transfers

This commit updates the policies for volume transfers to use the new
system-scope construct. It also introduces a read-only role for
application APIs.

This is inline with a broader change to provide more granular,
consistent, and secure RBAC across OpenStack projects.

Change-Id: Ib18858595507a9e59d95a0e139d566341431268c
'}, {'created': '2020-11-18 15:57:23.000000000', 'message': 'Implement secure RBAC for volume transfers

This commit updates the policies for volume transfers to use the new
system-scope construct. It also introduces a read-only role for
application APIs.

This is inline with a broader change to provide more granular,
consistent, and secure RBAC across OpenStack projects.

Change-Id: Ib18858595507a9e59d95a0e139d566341431268c
'}, {'created': '2021-02-17 17:06:31.000000000', 'message': 'Implement project personas for volume transfers

This commit updates the policies for volume transfers to use the default
roles provided from keystone.

This is inline with a broader change to provide more granular,
consistent, and secure RBAC across OpenStack projects.

Future changes will incorporate system-scope support for the
administrative actions when cinder fully supports system-scope.

commit_message:
Implement project personas for volume transfers

This commit updates the policies for volume transfers to use the default
roles provided from keystone. It also adds respective RBAC tests.

Future changes will incorporate system-scope support for the
administrative actions when cinder fully supports system-scope.

Co-Authored-by: Rajat Dhasmana <rajatdhasmana@gmail.com>

Change-Id: Ib18858595507a9e59d95a0e139d566341431268c

commit_message:
CI: Fix get_logs.sh docker logs output

Currently the logs get printed in Zuul job stdout and only a small portion
of them is redirected to a file - this patch changes that to send all output
to desired files.

Change-Id: I45e937ec7c102e89edee20679b8959bf7f6c7152
(cherry picked from commit 923813ac4820044723814b777e4a39cb6eb273fe)

This patch changes the way to get interface name.
With this fix, bash hostmonitor gets it by using ip route instead of ifconfig.
And it won't fail to get the interface name on RHEL.

Closes-Bug: #1762958

commit_message:
Change the way to get interface name

This patch changes the way to get interface name.
With this fix, bash hostmonitor gets it by using ip route instead of ifconfig.
And it won't fail to get the interface name on RHEL.

Change-Id: I483e130029c30b960eb6d55f288435c4c570af0a
Closes-Bug: #1762958

> So what you are saying is if pacemaker_remote is used, operator must set config option "restrict_to_remotes" to True. Is it correct?

That's right.

> If yes, I think there must be a pre-check logic while starting hostmonitor to confirm the configuration is done correctly otherwise it shouldn't start hostmonitor service.

I have added the following pre-check logic to _check_hb_line().
・"restrict_to_remotes" in the host section of the configuration file must be True when it works on pacemaker-remote.
・"restrict_to_remotes" in the host section of the configuration file must be False when it works on pacemaker.'}, {'account_id': 8988, 'date': '2020-08-05 06:38:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

commit_message:
Prevents the wrong notification when only own node is offline

This patch fixed the code so that hostmonitor doesn't monitor
pacemaker_remote nodes when own node is offline.
By this fix, when own node is isolated in the network, the hostmonitor
won't throw failure notifications about the healthy node.

Change-Id: Id9c08e0cfc4b4063e0fd70b5264bc1977a912937
Closes-Bug: #1878548

commit_message:
Implement Xena project personas for volume types

Implements the 3 Xena personas (no system scope).  Also:
- introduces new policies for volume-type create, update, and delete
  and deprecates the old "types manage" rule
- deprecates rule 'volume_extension:volume_type_encryption'

Co-authored-by: Lance Bragstad <lbragstad@gmail.com>
Co-authored-by: Brian Rosmaita <rosmaita.fossdev@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I52de98d80e80e2c315c6e329a9ead6f83713eca2

commit_message:
Ensure members are deleted from pools when there is no endpoints

This patch ensures that endpoints scale down to 0 event is handled
and therefore members are deleted from the loadbalancer pool

Change-Id: Idb879245607a6f0f914a44220312d54aa40e2e3d
Closes-Bug: 1904395

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-08-18 09:56:48.000000000', 'message': 'Update, avoid task skipping by directly importing step file.

During update we skip a lot tasks because we loop over the same update
step task file, changing the step variable, wasting time and
clobbering logs.

To solve the skipped tasks this, we now loop over the stepX file
generated for update and post update.

Expanding the playbook to import the tasks and setting the step
variable has another benefit.  It opens the possibility to use
"start-at-tasks" as everything is imported.  Using loop variable and
include_tasks prevented its usage.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/740465
(cherry picked from commit 2c1db9ed05d9cd4ffe64419a22751272af139c0f)

Change-Id: I368f75a1c20928b825a7b055af6313e0a0f030c6
'}]
commit_message:
Update, avoid task skipping by directly importing step file.

During update we skip a lot tasks because we loop over the same update
step task file, changing the step variable, wasting time and
clobbering logs.

To solve the skipped tasks this, we now loop over the stepX file
generated for update and post update.

Expanding the playbook to import the tasks and setting the step
variable has another benefit.  It opens the possibility to use
"start-at-tasks" as everything is imported.  Using loop variable and
include_tasks prevented its usage.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/740465
(cherry picked from commit 2c1db9ed05d9cd4ffe64419a22751272af139c0f)

Change-Id: I368f75a1c20928b825a7b055af6313e0a0f030c6

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2020-10-07 21:29:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2020-10-08 04:05:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> That original fix I mentioned[2] was really to fix the unit tests, which *do* install ansible-2.10

OK, This patch also fixes the unit tests by using correct imports. What I wanted to understand is that the approach you suggested actually works with 2.10 as the documentation seems to suggest to change the imports like what I've done here."}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2020-10-08 04:39:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

*approach you suggested actually works with 2.10 functional jobs (not unit tests)'}, {'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2020-10-08 22:04:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: -Code-Review

> OK, This patch also fixes the unit tests by using correct imports. What I wanted to understand is that the approach you suggested actually works with 2.10 as the documentation seems to suggest to change the imports like what I've done here.

I've just written a test module[1] to see what the behaviour is with different combinations of 2.9, 2.10 and the openstack collections installed, while importing from  ansible.module_utils.openstack or ansible_collections.openstack.cloud.plugins.module_utils.openstack 

2.9 (only ansible.module_utils.openstack worked)
2.9+ansible-collections-openstack (both worked)
2.10+ansible-collections-openstack (both worked)

It looks like the runtime dynamic population[2] of ansible.module_utils.openstack still works with ansible-collections-openstack.

So my take is that if you're not explicitly installing ansible-collections-openstack with ansible-2.9 then using ansible.module_utils will result in it working for both ansible-2.9 and ansible-2.10.

If you don't care about it working on ansible-2.9 then either import is fine but ansible_collections.openstack.cloud.plugins.module_utils.openstack will also work for unit tests *if* you've installed ansible-collections-openstack.

I'm not sure if you're aim is to have tripleo-ansible working on both 2.9 and 2.10. I think its achievable. I'll remove my -1 since there are multiple paths forward and its not really clear to me which is best.

[1] http://paste.openstack.org/show/798884/
[2] https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/dev_guide/developing_module_utilities.html#using-and-developing-module-utilities"}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2021-09-13 18:31:11.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Abandoning this patch per the TripleO Patch Abandonment guidelines
(https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/tripleo-specs/specs/policy/patch-abandonment.html).
If you wish to have this restored and cannot do so yourself, please reach out
via #tripleo on OFTC or the OpenStack Dev mailing list.'}]

commit_message:
WIP Fix openstack module import

Ansible 2.10.0 has moved the openstack module to a new
collection. This fixes the imports. But I guess
can't be used till 2.10.0 packages are availble for
centos8 and rhel8 for non pip installs.

Closes-Bug: #1896738
Change-Id: Ia205c8bde3210cde5755ae1f5485020d77771009

commit_message:
Add an upgrade job to tripleo-ansible.

As tripleo-ansible contains more and more of the main workflow of ooo,
we need to add some more coverage.  Here we add a non-voting upgrade
related job.

The depends on is a fix to the multinode standalone upgrade.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/755312

Change-Id: If72874b21a266722e467af39bb2809636e3e64a2

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-09-29 15:06:55.000000000', 'message': "DNM TESTING Deprecate Keepalived service

We don't deploy Keepalived in multi-node as our HA story is done with
Pacemaker. Therefore, we don't use VRRP protocol that Keepalived
provides to maintain the VIPs alive, so we don't really need this
service.

Instead, we can configure the VIPs on the br-ctlplane interface which
already handled the local_ip. Now it also handles the configuration of
public ip and admin ip.

Keepalived is now deprecated and will be removed in the next cycle.

(cherry picked from commit c712355e4bae4ef2fc1b83e5603c0364dbd50a78)
blueprint replace-keepalived-undercloud
Change-Id: I3192be07cb6c19d5e26cb4cddbe68213e7e48937
"}]
commit_message:
DNM TESTING Deprecate Keepalived service

We don't deploy Keepalived in multi-node as our HA story is done with
Pacemaker. Therefore, we don't use VRRP protocol that Keepalived
provides to maintain the VIPs alive, so we don't really need this
service.

Instead, we can configure the VIPs on the br-ctlplane interface which
already handled the local_ip. Now it also handles the configuration of
public ip and admin ip.

Keepalived is now deprecated and will be removed in the next cycle.

(cherry picked from commit c712355e4bae4ef2fc1b83e5603c0364dbd50a78)
blueprint replace-keepalived-undercloud
Change-Id: I3192be07cb6c19d5e26cb4cddbe68213e7e48937

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-05 14:38:45.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Add the possibility to run subscription command individually.

This would offer the possibility to run subscription commands before
running the update.  This enable the user to do some pre-tasks before
running the update like running a yum download on all the node before
the update window and thus speed up the process.

The undercloud part is not clear, as heat compilation and ansible run
are intermixed, I just put it there as an idea (maybe
a openstack undercloud upgrade --compile-playbooks options to be able
to create new playbooks without running the update, maybe such command
already exist ...)

The overcloud part is more easy as we have the

   openstack overcloud update prepare

command.

We could just then run something like:

   openstack overcloud external-update run --tags rhsm-subscription-overcloud

and then we would need something like:

   openstack overcloud update run --skip-subscription --limit ...

or maybe being able to pass down skip tags ?

Change-Id: I09df4b2cf3faa83b8e14e5a00a9635abfc21af4e
'}, {'created': '2020-06-05 15:13:44.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Add the possibility to run subscription command individually.

This would offer the possibility to run subscription commands before
running the update.  This enable the user to do some pre-tasks before
running the update like running a yum download on all the node before
the update window and thus speed up the process.

The undercloud part is not clear, as heat compilation and ansible run
are intermixed, I just put it there as an idea (maybe
a openstack undercloud upgrade --compile-playbooks options to be able
to create new playbooks without running the update, maybe such command
already exist ...)

The overcloud part is more easy as we have the

   openstack overcloud update prepare

command.

We could just then run something like:

   openstack overcloud external-update run --tags rhsm-subscription-overcloud

and then we would need something like:

   openstack overcloud update run --skip-subscription --limit ...

or maybe being able to pass down skip tags ?

Change-Id: I09df4b2cf3faa83b8e14e5a00a9635abfc21af4e
'}]
commit_message:
[WIP] Add the possibility to run subscription command individually.

This would offer the possibility to run subscription commands before
running the update.  This enable the user to do some pre-tasks before
running the update like running a yum download on all the node before
the update window and thus speed up the process.

The undercloud part is not clear, as heat compilation and ansible run
are intermixed, I just put it there as an idea (maybe
a openstack undercloud upgrade --compile-playbooks options to be able
to create new playbooks without running the update, maybe such command
already exist ...)

The overcloud part is more easy as we have the

   openstack overcloud update prepare

command.

We could just then run something like:

   openstack overcloud external-update run --tags rhsm-subscription-overcloud

and then we would need something like:

   openstack overcloud update run --skip-subscription --limit ...

or maybe being able to pass down skip tags ?

Change-Id: I09df4b2cf3faa83b8e14e5a00a9635abfc21af4e

commit_message:
WIP DNM - Deprecate PacemakerRemoteAuthkey

With pcs >= 0.10 we started delegating authkey creation to pcs itself
(puppet-pacemaker commit fde568564d43c78bf2828d3c981d5cc685fb3369) that
in turn switched to 256 bytes keys to allow for FIPS mode to be enabled.
See rhbz#1740218 for additional details on the pcs change.

This commit removes PacemakerRemoteAuthkey from the secrets to be
generated by tripleo.

depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/741130

Change-Id: Id87dbde14bc37eaf336939b86b733beaa1b2e022

As mistral is still the default way to run the update/upgrade/ffwd in Train/OSP16.0/OSP16.1 , if we merge this option we will be testing something different from what we provide to operators."}, {'account_id': 26343, 'date': '2020-04-21 11:46:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

I can understand this change in master, but for Train I would avoid setting it as the default way of testing the job.'}, {'account_id': 16515, 'date': '2020-04-21 11:50:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow-1

Hey José Luis,

On master, it already run without mistral (it's the default).
We need to test it on Train, and probably be by default on Train as well, since we got a lot of issues with Mistral with Ansible.

Btw the CI job is false positive, as you said on the depends on review, the limit_hosts doesn't work, I guess there is a bug with the "nodes" string.'}, {'account_id': 26343, 'date': '2020-04-21 12:05:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> Hey José Luis,

 > Btw the CI job is false positive, as you said on the depends on
 > review, the limit_hosts doesn't work, I guess there is a bug with
 > the "nodes" string.

Sure, I agree we need to test this. As some customers might want (or might be forced) to skip mistral. My concern is setting it as the default way of testing the update upstream (we would still have downstream with Mistral though), as some bug related to Mistral might scape from the upstream testing. In theory, it wouldn't be very hard to just create a new updates CI job, for example, a tripleo-ci-centos-7-scenario000-multinode-oooq-container-no-mistral-updates and run the update without mistral. But I guess we would need CI folks blessing.'}, {'account_id': 16515, 'date': '2020-04-21 12:31:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: -Workflow

recheck'}, {'account_id': 16515, 'date': '2020-04-21 18:26:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I understand José.
The issue with this option not tested is that it can be broken really quick.

I'm wondering of an alternative solution:
the upgrade job is still running Ansible over Mistral, this review implement only for update, so it's a mitigation: 
no-workflow for update
mistral for upgrade
It's pretty much the same code of the framework for the Run step."}, {'account_id': 8297, 'date': '2020-04-23 13:24:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

So the way I see it is:

  - no-workflow as a flag, so that it can be activated/deactivated from the job configuration;
  - upstream/master we implement the no-workflow with oooq
  - downstream/osp17 we implement the no-workflow and make sure doc/code is set to that downstream as well
  - upstream/train: we implement no-workflow upstream if that's what is documented upstream (please provide associated link)
  - downstream/train: we don't implement it until it's official in the documentation."}, {'account_id': 16515, 'date': '2020-04-23 13:36:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Run Update without mistral workflow in CI

Force to run update without mistral action.
This option is default in master, we have it in Train but no tested.
This option should be tested in CI, ortherwise
it will be broken

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-14 15:02:46.000000000', 'message': "Add a note about HA in podman.yaml

I recently started deploying tripleo on CentOS 8 and I replaced my
docker.yaml and docker-ha.yaml environment files with podman.yaml. I
noticed issues during my overcloud deployment due to rabbit being
misconfigured:

  could not start kernel pid (application_controller) (invalid config
  data: application: rabbit; duplicate parameter:
  cluster_partition_handling)

This is because I assumed podman.yaml to contain everything I needed
for an HA deployment. Instead, I need to use docker-ha.yaml, which uses
podman as the ContainerCli, despite the name. It also contains all the
necesary configuration for rabbit and pacemaker in highly-available
environments (so you don't hit the error above).

This commit adds a note to the podman.yaml environment that describes
how it is useful for standalone deployments and points people to
docker-ha.yaml if they're looking for HA support.

Change-Id: Iff525db59bccbead8ea5085ca7b3122d3c530287
"}]
commit_message:
Add a note about HA in podman.yaml

I recently started deploying tripleo on CentOS 8 and I replaced my
docker.yaml and docker-ha.yaml environment files with podman.yaml. I
noticed issues during my overcloud deployment due to rabbit being
misconfigured:

  could not start kernel pid (application_controller) (invalid config
  data: application: rabbit; duplicate parameter:
  cluster_partition_handling)

This is because I assumed podman.yaml to contain everything I needed
for an HA deployment. Instead, I need to use docker-ha.yaml, which uses
podman as the ContainerCli, despite the name. It also contains all the
necesary configuration for rabbit and pacemaker in highly-available
environments (so you don't hit the error above).

This commit adds a note to the podman.yaml environment that describes
how it is useful for standalone deployments and points people to
docker-ha.yaml if they're looking for HA support.

Change-Id: Iff525db59bccbead8ea5085ca7b3122d3c530287

check https://review.opendev.org/744000 for the queens only review.'}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2021-09-13 18:29:10.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Abandoning this patch per the TripleO Patch Abandonment guidelines
(https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/tripleo-specs/specs/policy/patch-abandonment.html).
If you wish to have this restored and cannot do so yourself, please reach out
via #tripleo on OFTC or the OpenStack Dev mailing list.'}]

commit_message:
Skip openvswitch restart if overcloud-minimal is used

openvswitch package is not installed in overcloud-minimal and
upgrade fails due to this service restart.  This patch avoids
restarting openvswitch if the openvswitch package is not installed.

Change-Id: I59cdebb1ff8b3c4625ad8f53c444db63b3418092
Closes-bug: #1875743

Since the undercloud is containerized, we need to enable FIPS at the
container-level to achieve FIPS compliance.

commit_message:
WIP: Add fips package to base container packages

Since the undercloud is containerized, we need to enable FIPS at the
container-level to achieve FIPS compliance.

This commit adds the FIPS package to the base container packages.

Change-Id: I71ab6447338d81fb5e6b665cbe66fa4ed79a4de1

commit_message:
Update hide sensitive data to be dynamic

This change will unmask our no-log options if either the global
"hide_sensitive_logs" is set to `true` or if the internal ansible
verbosity is set to a value greater than or equal to 3.

Change-Id: Iada751672788da557f1b5b7e68446bedd6c5d6db
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
[DNM] Making tempest_public_net_name variable ovarridable.

tempest_public_net_name variable is used by tempest
to define public network name. In ironic default
network is "provisioning" network. To run ironic
tempest tests we need to create same network which
is defined in the ironic.conf. It will avoid modifying
network name in ironic.conf and other files.

This changes are going to reflect in
triplo-ci-centos-8-scenario012-standalone job.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/720705/
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/731704/

Change-Id: I266c53c8a2e0461defb8167cdd96a8f02a763e7c
Signed-off-by: Amol Kahat <amolkahat@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Use stack environment for container image prepare

Use stack environment when availabe, this will help us avoid
doing avoid updating role data to remove OS::Heat::None
services multiple times.

Change-Id: I915743879ccb3b69fae32880d8047dd0e13e3fbd

commit_message:
Centos8 undercloud upgrade - rename & split ussuri voting/gating

This splits the centos8 undercloud upgrade job to master/ussuri
versions. The ussui one should be voting but blocked on related
bug below. Tracked by tripleo-ci at [1]. Also drops the
'containerized' bit from the name.

[1] https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/task/1817
Related-Bug: 1888411

Change-Id: I75d9f3f8541e18e171b9f48e4f40e1bc6ce57c04

commit_message:
move periodic defs to periodic.yml

Just organizing where periodic jobs are defined.
If periodic jobs are in a zuul template they can
run more than once at the same time.

Change-Id: Ic022a09cfa2c6cf097268d16346f63e04d658406

commit_message:
[WIP] Remove deprecated files and parameters.

These have either been stated to be removed in Train (or an earlier
release) or have been deprecated for over a year. These file have
newer alternative templates/parameters or are no longer used.

Change-Id: I72ea326aa4ae4fe501fd133a0764c72e05ed0e01
Signed-off-by: Luke Short <ekultails@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Expose the Apache WSGI timeout

This applies to all OpenStack services managed by Puppet.

Also increase the timeout from 60 to 600 seconds for the
Undercloud, UndercloudMinion, and Standalone composable roles
where the API response times are slower.

Aodh
Depends-On: Ic5055279770342d244ef3a4592067351981b459a

commit_message:
WIP: Speed up plan operations by using a tarball in swift.

Use a tarball in swift instead of the expanded archive to
speed up plan operations using swift.

Co-Authored-By: Dan Prince <dprince@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Brad P. Crochet <brad@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I21caef1a3e6206d6c427140fd28b5f2ea6c68ef0

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-09-25 11:52:28.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure LANG env is properly set when puppet runs.

We need to ensure that proper locale are passed down to the puppet
process.

Puppet modules related to openstack actively read the openstack
database.  The default locale in a container is "C", so any "UTF-8"
related character in the database will make puppet fail.

Here we offer:
 - a way for the user to override it completly (not recommanded, but
   maybe it has a use)
 - if nothing is provided they we chack the running env for any locale
   and if everything fail we set it to a saner than "C" default.

Change-Id: Iea6798ffdc961e91f3d8700f7d415eb01c579b52
Closes-Bug: #1896640
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure LANG env is properly set when puppet runs.

We need to ensure that proper locale are passed down to the puppet
process.

Puppet modules related to openstack actively read the openstack
database.  The default locale in a container is "C", so any "UTF-8"
related character in the database will make puppet fail.

Here we offer:
 - a way for the user to override it completly (not recommanded, but
   maybe it has a use)
 - if nothing is provided they we chack the running env for any locale
   and if everything fail we set it to a saner than "C" default.

Change-Id: Iea6798ffdc961e91f3d8700f7d415eb01c579b52
Closes-Bug: #1896640

[{'created': '2020-09-18 09:02:37.000000000', 'message': 'AllNodesValidationConfig fails on multiple host groups

Fix the way how AllNodesValidationConfig handle more complex host
groups, when some rubish is passed to Python one-line script which
validates IP addresses.

Closes-Bug: #1896200

commit_message:
AllNodesValidationConfig fails on multiple host groups

Fix the way how AllNodesValidationConfig handle more complex host
groups, when some rubish is passed to Python one-line script which
validates IP addresses.

Change-Id: I2e6ad28b90032a4948f2bad2a1fa2dc2aa9d01bf
Closes-Bug: #1896200

commit_message:
NetApp ONTAP: Add option to report storage provisioned capacity

This patch adds option ´netapp_driver_reports_provisioned_capacity´,
for driver to calculate the storage provisioned capacity by queryng
volume sizes directly from the storage system and reporting as a
pool capability ´provisioned_capacity_gb´, instead of relying
on the default behavior of using scheduler and volume service
internal states as done by ´allocated_capacity_gb´.

Implements: blueprint ontap-report-provisioned-capacity
Change-Id: I97625de865a63b0cf725f61d9d2ea3c44740d9e7

[{'created': '2021-07-16 22:24:40.000000000', 'message': "[senlin-tempest-plugin] Tag train-last

Train branch is in Extended Maintenance now[1]. Tempest and
tempest plugins are branchless which means master version of
Tempest and its plugins is used to test the supported stable
branches.

Once any stable branch is moved to EM state then, Tempest and
its plugins compatible tag[2] needs to be released so that we can
keep testing the EM stable branches with that tag once master
Tempest and its plugins are not compatible[3].

Tagging 'train-last'[4] as well as a new version also with same hash.

[1] https://releases.openstack.org/train/index.html
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/stable_branch_support_policy.html
[3] https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/tempest_and_plugins_compatible_version_policy.html
[4] https://docs.openstack.org/project-team-guide/stable-branches.html#extended-maintenance

Change-Id: Ib0de1dfb95a29264828c8315e1b6eb212eb8db9d

commit_message:
[senlin-tempest-plugin] Tag train-last

Train branch is in Extended Maintenance now[1]. Tempest and
tempest plugins are branchless which means master version of
Tempest and its plugins is used to test the supported stable
branches.

Once any stable branch is moved to EM state then, Tempest and
its plugins compatible tag[2] needs to be released so that we can
keep testing the EM stable branches with that tag once master
Tempest and its plugins are not compatible[3].

Tagging 'train-last'[4] as well as a new version also with same hash.

[1] https://releases.openstack.org/train/index.html
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/stable_branch_support_policy.html
[3] https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/tempest_and_plugins_compatible_version_policy.html
[4] https://docs.openstack.org/project-team-guide/stable-branches.html#extended-maintenance

Change-Id: Ib0de1dfb95a29264828c8315e1b6eb212eb8db9d

commit_message:
[sahara-tests] Tag train-last

Train branch is in Extended Maintenance now[1]. Tempest and
tempest plugins are branchless which means master version of
Tempest and its plugins is used to test the supported stable
branches.

Once any stable branch is moved to EM state then, Tempest and
its plugins compatible tag[2] needs to be released so that we can
keep testing the EM stable branches with that tag once master
Tempest and its plugins are not compatible[3].

Tagging 'train-last'[4] with thr latest hash.

[1] https://releases.openstack.org/train/index.html
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/stable_branch_support_policy.html
[3] https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/tempest_and_plugins_compatible_version_policy.html
[4] https://docs.openstack.org/project-team-guide/stable-branches.html#extended-maintenance

Hi,

I'm trying to enable secure boot(OpenStack Wallaby on Ubuntu 20.04) and see following error in nova-compute.log:
    libvirt.libvirtError: unsupported configuration: Secure boot requires SMM feature enabled

Looks like adding "guest.os_firmware ='efi'" is a simple way to enable SMM.

commit_message:
Secure boot requires SMM feature enabled

See following error in nova-compute.log when secure boot is enabled:

libvirt.libvirtError: unsupported configuration: Secure boot requires SMM feature enabled

With "<os firmware='efi'>", libvirt will automatically enable SMM
and the features in libvirtl xml will eventually look like:

  <features>
    <acpi/>
    <apic/>
    <smm state='on'/>
  </features>

Change-Id: Ifd0e6c700a470f03468cf406f560735a3cbfc8c5

commit_message:

[{'created': '2020-07-15 09:38:51.000000000', 'message': 'Deprecate PacemakerRemoteAuthkey

With pcs >= 0.10 we started delegating authkey creation to pcs itself
(puppet-pacemaker commit fde568564d43c78bf2828d3c981d5cc685fb3369) that
in turn switched to 256 bytes keys to allow for FIPS mode to be enabled.
See rhbz#1740218 for additional details on the pcs change.

This commit removes PacemakerRemoteAuthkey in line with the respective
tripleo-common change: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/741128.

Change-Id: I11acc935b4ff51aa038dad953fb3d70780276db7
'}]
commit_message:
Deprecate PacemakerRemoteAuthkey

With pcs >= 0.10 we started delegating authkey creation to pcs itself
(puppet-pacemaker commit fde568564d43c78bf2828d3c981d5cc685fb3369) that
in turn switched to 256 bytes keys to allow for FIPS mode to be enabled.
See rhbz#1740218 for additional details on the pcs change.

This commit removes PacemakerRemoteAuthkey in line with the respective
tripleo-common change: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/741128.

Change-Id: I11acc935b4ff51aa038dad953fb3d70780276db7

[{'created': '2020-06-02 19:05:29.000000000', 'message': "Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238
[4] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105

Change-Id: I437cd8a60ca168732ea0e2872f725248dbf75ab1
"}]
commit_message:
Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238
[4] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105
[5] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3112
[6] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0343
[7] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0328

Change-Id: I437cd8a60ca168732ea0e2872f725248dbf75ab1

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-05 14:38:45.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure rhel enforcement always happen after changing the repos.

We need to enforce a certain policy during update (and deployment as
well) for subscribed OSP.  Problem is that the current ordering force
the user to change its subscription manually before update.

So we move the enforcement call to be run just after we call the
subscription role.

We also make sure the host_prep_tasks happens before running all the
update tasks.  So that we run yum upgrade on the right repos.

The new ordering is now :
 - hiera,
 - host prep tasks
 - update tasks
 - deploy step tasks 0
 - deploy step tasks 1
 - deploy step tasks 1-5
 - post update step tasks

Before this change host prep tasks was happening before deploy step
tasks 0.

Change-Id: I933380892a205670baed242a4948316bfd444bf8
'}, {'created': '2020-06-05 15:13:44.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure rhel enforcement always happen after changing the repos.

We need to enforce a certain policy during update (and deployment as
well) for subscribed OSP.  Problem is that the current ordering force
the user to change its subscription manually before update.

So we move the enforcement call to be run just after we call the
subscription role.

We also make sure the host_prep_tasks happens before running all the
update tasks.  So that we run yum upgrade on the right repos.

The new ordering is now :
 - hiera,
 - host prep tasks
 - update tasks
 - deploy step tasks 0
 - deploy step tasks 1
 - deploy step tasks 1-5
 - post update step tasks

Before this change host prep tasks was happening before deploy step
tasks 0.

'}, {'created': '2020-07-02 16:06:56.000000000', 'message': 'Refactor rhel enforcement for overcloud.

well) for subscribed OSP.  Problem is that the current ordering force
the user to change its subscription manually before update.

Then, there is no way to change the repos outside without
running the full update.  This can be a source of necessary issues and
would be best, in some environments, to be able to run this on its
own.

the subscription role.

update tasks.  Now, we run yum upgrade on the right repos.

 - host prep tasks
 - update tasks
 - deploy step tasks 0
 - deploy step tasks 1
 - deploy step tasks 1-5

tasks 0.

prep tasks).  As it may happen that the user is using manual
registration for its overcloud nodes.  Thus the user would not include
the rhsm-baremetal-ansible definition.  When we detect such situation,
ie, RhsmVars is empty, we create the enforcement tasks.  If RhsmVars
is not empty then a debug message is emitted instead.

subscription tasks accessible to the user are:
 - add the tags "always" to the hiera data tasks;
 - add the tag "rhsm-subscription" to the subscription/enforcement.

This enable the user to use:

    openstack overcloud update run --tags rhsm-subscription

, given that the RhsmVars was updated and loaded into heat (via
openstack update prepare).  Thus the user can run subscription related
command before doing the update.

Then during update the user can use:

   openstack overcloud update run --skip-tags rhsm-subscription --limit Controller

to avoid subscription related tasks.

commit_message:
Refactor rhel enforcement for overcloud.

We need to enforce a certain policy during update (and deployment as
well) for subscribed OSP.  Problem is that the current ordering force
the user to change its subscription manually before update.

Then, there is no way to change the repos outside without
running the full update.  This can be a source of necessary issues and
would be best, in some environments, to be able to run this on its
own.

This patch addresses those two issues.

For the first part, we move the enforcement call to run after we call
the subscription role.

We also make sure the host_prep_tasks happens before running all the
update tasks.  Now, we run yum upgrade on the right repos.

The new ordering is now :
 - hiera,
 - host prep tasks
 - update tasks
 - deploy step tasks 0
 - deploy step tasks 1
 - deploy step tasks 1-5
 - post update step tasks

Before this change host prep tasks was happening before deploy step
tasks 0.

Note that we still keep an enforcement during update tasks (vs host
prep tasks).  As it may happen that the user is using manual
registration for its overcloud nodes.  Thus the user would not include
the rhsm-baremetal-ansible definition.  When we detect such situation,
ie, RhsmVars is empty, we create the enforcement tasks.  If RhsmVars
is not empty then a debug message is emitted instead.

For the second point, the only necessary changes to make the
subscription tasks accessible to the user are:
 - add the tags "always" to the hiera data tasks;
 - add the tag "rhsm-subscription" to the subscription/enforcement.

This enable the user to use:

    openstack overcloud update run --tags rhsm-subscription

, given that the RhsmVars was updated and loaded into heat (via
openstack update prepare).  Thus the user can run subscription related
command before doing the update.

Then during update the user can use:

   openstack overcloud update run --skip-tags rhsm-subscription --limit Controller

to avoid subscription related tasks.

Change-Id: I933380892a205670baed242a4948316bfd444bf8

so i don't think you can do this at this level. Check with Emilien as he was talking about how to actually use t-o-a at the PTG. I believe in order to use it, you need to actually have zuul invoke ansible-playbook instead of relying on zuul to do the top level execution of anything tripleo-operator-ansible related.  You might check with #zuul to see if collections might be on the table at somepoint in zuul, but I'm assuming it's not because there are security related implications for plugins"}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2020-06-22 12:01:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 28.'}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2020-06-23 09:05:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 29.'}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2020-06-23 09:07:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 30.'}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2020-06-23 11:30:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 30:

 > believe in order to use it, you need to actually have zuul invoke
 > ansible-playbook instead of relying on zuul to do the top level
 > execution of anything tripleo-operator-ansible related.  You might
 > check with #zuul to see if collections might be on the table at
 > somepoint in zuul, but I'm assuming it's not because there are
 > security related implications for plugins


thanks for commenting - I am reaching the same conclusion.

I think there are 2 things

1. the version of ansible and how supported collections are - in the job here we have 2.8.11

2. ansible configuring itself to edit ansible.cfg so it can read the collections modules by setting 'library' and 'collections_path'.

I think we mainly have to do 2 because of 1. The trouble with doing 2 is that we have ansible all the way from the start here - the 'top' level for us for that job is in the pre there https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci/src/commit/331bd37b25414826409d358b4fde79833dfbad4c/playbooks/tripleo-buildimages/pre.yaml - i.e. zuul is executing ansible playbooks directly via job pre/run parameters.

I don't even know if ansible can configure itself. I recall a discussion about some protection against editing ansible.cfg but I may be mistaken. 
Let's see anyway I set these on latest version as a last sanity check using inifile there https://review.opendev.org/#/c/733818/30/roles/oooci-build-images/tasks/pre.yaml

WRT collections support - I think we need 2.9. On my 2.8.12 box there is nothing about 'collections' in the default /usr/share/ansible.cfg"}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2020-06-23 11:54:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 31: Published edit on patch set 30.'}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2020-06-24 07:46:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 31:

commit_message:
Outline directions for undercloud TLS

We're already reorganizing the old SSL guide since much of it needs to
change because the implementation for TLS-everywhere changed. We can
take this opportunity to freshen up and validate the SSL undercloud
guide and make it consistent with the rest of the TLS documentation.

Change-Id: I32c8282869920cd710e148c09e67dfe81f937551

This will facilitate disabling the enforcement when it's needed.

Change-Id: Ia694bf57014b074e28d824a8b0e7f5bfec608ec6

subject: Replaced mount z option with setype
messages:
[{'account_id': 31982, 'date': '2020-05-15 17:39:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2020-05-15 17:39:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Congratulations, you've proposed your first change in OpenDev.

Your submission will now be tested automatically by Zuul, our gatekeeper,
and reviewed by other friendly developers. They will give you feedback and
may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches often take days (and sometimes weeks) to get reviewed, so be
patient. Don't hesitate to ask for help, and answer questions about your
work promptly if you can. The more you get to know reviewers and get to be
known by them, the smoother the review and approval process will become. The
fastest way to accomplish this is by reviewing other proposed changes
yourself: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for participating in OpenDev, we look forward to seeing you
around.

Workflow Guide: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html"}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2020-05-21 15:59:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

thanks!'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2020-05-22 20:12:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Hi Bilal,

Thanks for your first contribution to OpenStack and TripleO! This is awesome.

Would you mind editing your patch and adding a multi-line commit message explaining why this change.

Example:

#####
nova-libvirt: replace mountz option with setype

In the nova-libivrt container bind mounts, use the setype
instead of the z option because X and Y reasons.
#####

You can do it with the following command:

  git commit -a --amend


Thanks a lot!'}, {'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2020-06-01 07:00:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

As Emilien said: a more explicit message is needed.

In addition: there will be an issue if, for some reasons, an operator runs a system relabeling, it will go back to the default label, which is probably var_lib_t or something like that, preventing the container to properly access things.
SELinux playing its usual tricks ;).'}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2021-09-13 16:58:47.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Abandoning this patch per the TripleO Patch Abandonment guidelines
(https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/tripleo-specs/specs/policy/patch-abandonment.html).
If you wish to have this restored and cannot do so yourself, please reach out
via #tripleo on OFTC or the OpenStack Dev mailing list.'}]

commit_message:
Update Octavia certificates in running amphorae

Update certificates and restart octavia-agent in running amphorae when
certificates are being updated on controllers.
It requires having access to the amphora ssh private key from the
undercloud. In case ssh private key cannot be found, performing a
failover of the existing load balancers is needed.

Change-Id: I34e0fe2048365c38dd52a45fcc5f06d17f9bee1f
Related-Bug: #1869203

(3 comments)

-1 to encourage some conversation on the comments inline; I think I understand the problem but this change has various implications depending on the specific version of Ceph/OSD deployed

Note that in pike and queens we did not intend to deploy on baremetal'}, {'account_id': 17280, 'date': '2018-02-27 14:37:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2018-02-27 14:54:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 17280, 'date': '2018-02-27 14:58:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-02-27 15:19:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2018-02-27 15:44:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2018-02-27 15:45:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-02-27 16:00:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: -Code-Review

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2018-02-27 16:03:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 17280, 'date': '2018-02-27 17:40:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

I think it needs to be decided what is supported, and then we can go from there.  If this deployment is supported in master, we need a fix and a CI job that covers default services + ceph in non container.  If this deployment type is no longer supported in master, but is supported in pike, then a direct fix to pike makes sense.  If it is not supported in either case, then we abandon the patch.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-02-27 18:08:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

We've said that we don't support baremetal deployments as of Queens. We still use some baremetal deployments for some things but I believe the ceph-ansible is the supported way for deploying ceph for Queens+.  Since the fix seems to be a bit intrusive we probably should not apply it to master.  That being said, we should go through and clear out any of the things we no longer support around ceph so we don't have these questions."}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2018-02-28 10:55:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

ceph-ansible can only deploy in containers; puppet-ceph can deploy on baremetal

I guess that means for pike we supported both but from queens we don't support puppet-ceph anymore so I'll remove that code"}, {'account_id': 27427, 'date': '2018-10-12 12:29:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 20733, 'date': '2020-05-15 07:49:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2021-09-13 16:58:23.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Abandoning this patch per the TripleO Patch Abandonment guidelines
(https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/tripleo-specs/specs/policy/patch-abandonment.html).
If you wish to have this restored and cannot do so yourself, please reach out
via #tripleo on OFTC or the OpenStack Dev mailing list.'}]

commit_message:
Fixes Ceph pool creation with Gnocchi non-containerized deployments

When Gnocchi is using an rbd backend, it needs the the Ceph pool created
before the DB sync runs in step 3.  However, the pool creation was
happening in step 4.  This patch modifies the creation to happen in step
3 and ensures via resource ordering that the pool will be created before
Gnocchi db-sync occurs.

Closes-Bug: #1751359

Change-Id: I095258b442fd91c53a0d6c655aead1a3ffe73483
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>

commit_message:
OVN centos8: add ovn to the enabled providers

OVN jobs are failing tempest test
octavia_tempest_plugin.tests.scenario.v2.test_traffic_ops.TrafficOperationsScenarioTest

With error

"Provider 'ovn' is not enabled."

as tempest configuration is not setting an important value for the test.

This patch adds ovn provider to the list of enabled providers, so
the test can run.

equivalent to https://review.rdoproject.org/r/26694

Closes-Bug: #1877971
Change-Id: I0a210459b41afa307ef8f7c94e383d1da28c3efc

everything people need to know to deploy TLS-everywhere in their
overclouds.

[{'created': '2020-04-01 07:42:55.000000000', 'message': "WIP Fix Octavia certificate lifecycle

Add support for Dual CA: one server CA to validate the amphora HTTPS
server, one client CA to authenticate Octavia services in the amphora.

Client certificates are now unique for each host (previously we had only
one client certificate for a deployment).
Running amphorae are automatically updated with the new client CA, that
update doesn't interrupt the data plane (but the control plane is
stopped during a few seconds).

Change-Id: I9ad8e5e64337cd4766675e208f4d2c7cc8bc7f22

commit_message:
WIP Fix Octavia certificate lifecycle

Add support for Dual CA: one server CA to validate the amphora HTTPS
server, one client CA to authenticate Octavia services in the amphora.

Client certificates are now unique for each host (previously we had only
one client certificate for a deployment).
Running amphorae are automatically updated with the new client CA, that
update doesn't interrupt the data plane (but the control plane is
stopped during a few seconds).

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/723539/

Change-Id: I9ad8e5e64337cd4766675e208f4d2c7cc8bc7f22
Resolve-Bug: #1875358

commit_message:
Update machine_type from 'i440fx' to 'q35'; adjust for RHEL-8.1

Change [1] introduced NovaHWMachineType parameter to
set host machine_type explicitly.

This change modifies base machine_type OS to RHEL8.1 so
that guest instance with RHEL8.1 OS can be
spawned on compute nodes having RHEL8.1 host OS.

This change also modifies the default machine_type
from 'i440fx' to 'q35'.

[1] Ib57bfbb94e2acdfb3bb3a828ee3b085bf68d3b4c

Change-Id: I24b3e3a419f8170ab3fdfe40c5549e8301ac5c4d

[{'created': '2020-02-25 14:23:07.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Ensure we reload rhsm parameter before update.

Until now no new rhsm paremeter needed to be loaded during update.
But with rhel8.2, an new channel will be needed.

This make sure we reload rhsm configuration before running update so
that we can catch all new rhsm related configuration.

Change-Id: Id57df852329c5cecf6b4690c07062291fdaf5fb8
'}]
commit_message:
WIP: Ensure we reload rhsm parameter before update.

Until now no new rhsm paremeter needed to be loaded during update.
But with rhel8.2, an new channel will be needed.

This make sure we reload rhsm configuration before running update so
that we can catch all new rhsm related configuration.

Change-Id: Id57df852329c5cecf6b4690c07062291fdaf5fb8

[{'created': '2020-03-31 10:52:51.000000000', 'message': "[WIP] Drop short names joined by '.' in /etc/hosts

An entry such as hostname.ctlplane or hostname.external
is an FQDN, as if we have a top domain ctlplane. or external.

DNS-wize this is'nt correct.
WIP, because I'm not sure something depend on those short names
or if we can simplify the templates.

Change-Id: I1bbe869b421f8aae05bdc4f1a27324f865a6d374
"}]
commit_message:
[WIP] Drop short names joined by '.' in /etc/hosts

An entry such as hostname.ctlplane or hostname.external
is an FQDN, as if we have a top domain ctlplane. or external.

DNS-wize this is'nt correct.
WIP, because I'm not sure something depend on those short names
or if we can simplify the templates.

Change-Id: I1bbe869b421f8aae05bdc4f1a27324f865a6d374

commit_message:
[WIP] Drop short names joined by '.' in /etc/hosts

An entry such as hostname.ctlplane or hostname.external
is an FQDN, as if we have a top domain ctlplane. or external.

DNS-wize this is'nt correct.

WIP, because I'm not sure something depend on those short names
or if we can simplify the role.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/716236
Change-Id: I4e14f15d4175079b84c9944ec2415abe973c35e0

commit_message:
use message id cache for RPC listener

Return back the message id cache feature to RPC listener, it was
removed while refactoring in I708c3d6676b974d8daac6817c15f596cdf35817b
See attached bug for more info.

We should not raise DuplicateMessageError to avoid rejecting the
previously ACK'ed message.

Closes-Bug: #1935883
Change-Id: Ie237e9e3fdc3fc27b3deb18b94751cdc3afd190e

commit_message:
Change python3.5 job to python3.7 job on Stein+

python3.5 was the only supported python3 version on Xenial, now that we have
Bionic Beaver nodes that support python3.7, lets switch to testing with
python3.7 in addition with python3.6 in Stein and beyond.
See ML discussion here [1] for context. [

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135632.html

Change-Id: Ia9dda611578e0d8b3135f567c4f070a75f68e882
Signed-off-by: Charles Short <chucks@redhat.com>
Story: #2004073

commit_message:
[WIP] Spec to improve sudo use in TripleO

This spec seeks to gain consensus on encouraging a more secure
system of sudo use in TripleO.

Change-Id: I829275d7270d86876797a592fd0d0e88e31825f1

In the same line of Jose, this is not valid.

Checking this:

cat << EOF > test.yaml
---
  - name: "Playing with Ansible and Git"
    hosts: localhost
    connection: local
    vars:
      tripleo_backup_and_restore_rear_simulate: true
    tasks:

    - name: Create the node backup
      become: true
      command: rear {{ '-s ' if tripleo_backup_and_restore_rear_simulate else '' }}-d -v mkbackup
      register: tripleo_backup_and_restore_rear_output
      when: tripleo_backup_and_restore_rear_output is undefined

    - name: Display ReaR recovery image creation output
      debug:
	var: tripleo_backup_and_restore_rear_output
EOF

Please you need to execute the role and having this variable defined: tripleo_backup_and_restore_rear_simulate either with true or false



Also I tested the playbook as per:
git clone git@github.com:openstack/tripleo-ansible

cat <<'EOF' > ~/bar_rear_create_restore_images.yaml
# Playbook
# We run ReaR in the control plane nodes.
- become: true
  hosts: localhost
  name: Create the recovery images for the control plane
  roles:
  - role: backup-and-restore
EOF

export ANSIBLE_ROLES_PATH=~/tripleo-ansible/tripleo_ansible/roles/

cat <<'EOF' > ~/tripleo-inventory.yaml
[localhost]
localhost ansible_host=localhost ansible_connection=local
EOF

# Create recovery images of the control plane "simulated"
ansible-playbook \
    -v -i ~/tripleo-inventory.yaml \
    --extra="ansible_ssh_common_args='-o StrictHostKeyChecking=no' tripleo_backup_and_restore_rear_simulate=true tripleo_backup_and_restore_container_cli=podman tripleo_backup_and_restore_service_manager=false" \
    --become \
    --become-user root \
    --tags bar_create_recover_image \
    ~/bar_rear_create_restore_images.yaml

This runs as expected.'}, {'account_id': 26343, 'date': '2020-02-11 12:01:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
OIDC : Add support for setting OIDCClaimDelimiter

Depending on the configuration of the IdP and Keystone, without setting
the claim delimiter it's not possible to use multi-value claims.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/710442/
Change-Id: I9d35cbd474e6c0ba5e680e30da8e2a7e68145c13

commit_message:
Rely on delorean.repo.md5 to get version_hash

For CentOS8 component based repos aggregate hash
should should be get from delorean.repo.md5 instead of
system location delorean.repo as that file could
have been modified and hence changing checksum.

Closes-Bug: #1867580
Change-Id: If03ab6c9efa6094426898a8cfc780b5b7bf4a8bf

[{'created': '2021-09-13 09:54:59.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] db version fix

Change-Id: I9fa7c03310c5bdb82e9a9c39727edb12eeae77f0
'}, {'created': '2021-09-13 12:13:05.000000000', 'message': 'Fix nova-manage db version

When nova switched to alembic implementation was added to nova-manage db
version CLI to query the current db revision from alembic. However
multiple mistake was made.

The code called alembic_api.current[1] with an Engine object while that
call expects a Config object instead. This leads to but/1943436.

Also the same code expected that this call returns the revision. But
that call just prints the revision to the standard output instead.

So the implementations has been change from calling the alembic command
API which is mostly created for CLI consumption to
MigrationContext.get_current_revision() call that is intended to be used
as a python API instead.

[1] https://alembic.sqlalchemy.org/en/latest/api/commands.html#alembic.command.current

Co-Authored-By: Sean Mooney <smooney@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1943436

Change-Id: I9fa7c03310c5bdb82e9a9c39727edb12eeae77f0
'}]
commit_message:
Fix nova-manage db version

When nova switched to alembic implementation was added to nova-manage db
version CLI to query the current db revision from alembic. However
multiple mistake was made.

The code called alembic_api.current[1] with an Engine object while that
call expects a Config object instead. This leads to but/1943436.

Also the same code expected that this call returns the revision. But
that call just prints the revision to the standard output instead.

So the implementations has been change from calling the alembic command
API which is mostly created for CLI consumption to
MigrationContext.get_current_revision() call that is intended to be used
as a python API instead.

[1] https://alembic.sqlalchemy.org/en/latest/api/commands.html#alembic.command.current

Co-Authored-By: Sean Mooney <smooney@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1943436

commit_message:
Preliminary work to support CentOS 9 Stream

Changes package mappings to default to Python 3. Unfortunately, the
build does not work yet because of some issue in DIB.

Co-Authored-By: Dmitry Tantsur <dtantsur@protonmail.com>
Change-Id: I88c1ec2590d280745daa6c8b3aa9a719f5d96e72

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-02 14:54:12.000000000', 'message': 'Add Ghanshyam nomination as chair

I would like to nominate myself as chair of the
Technical Committee for Yoga cycle.

I served as TC Chair in Xena cycle and trying my best to be more
active in TC and leading the things in various form, for example,
community-wide goal, TC discussion or any reach out to project teams.

I would like to continue the chair role and try to improve the
TC interaction with rest of the community, engage TC in doing
more technical things, and help OpenStack community to achieve the
common goals.

Thanks for considering my nomination.

Change-Id: I80cfb7b9c2d7345646ae6f15c33daff214d01fca
'}]
commit_message:
Add Ghanshyam nomination as chair

I would like to nominate myself as chair of the
Technical Committee for Yoga cycle.

I served as TC Chair in Xena cycle and trying my best to be more
active in TC and leading the things in various form, for example,
community-wide goal, TC discussion or any reach out to project teams.

I would like to continue the chair role and try to improve the
TC interaction with rest of the community, engage TC in doing
more technical things, and help OpenStack community to achieve the
common goals.

Thanks for considering my nomination.

Change-Id: I80cfb7b9c2d7345646ae6f15c33daff214d01fca

commit_message:
Update master for stable/xena

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/xena.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/xena.

Sem-Ver: feature
Change-Id: Iedae419776a6f8937aec2d1ff05e917f8b78bfde

commit_message:
CI: copy bifrost logs to the log directory

Using them is more convenient than scrolling the whole output,
especially in case of upgrades.

Change-Id: Ib086f106a0e78d247bac5fa63801c2fecb40efa8

Note: This is the short-term less-invasive fix. The mid-long term fix

commit_message:
Guarantee that ovn-dbs-pcmk update_tasks are run when the cluster is up

On particular role compositions, the code joining the update_tasks might order
things differently then on a typical 3ctrl control plane and the ovn-dbs tasks
at step1 (which require the cluster to be up) will happen after the pacemaker
task at step1 which stops the cluster.

So we can observe something like the following:
2021-09-10 10:05:13.370339 | 001c2891-506d-f833-ff5a-000000000954 | TASK | Change the bundle operation timeout
2021-09-10 10:05:14.136798 | 001c2891-506d-f833-ff5a-000000000954 | CHANGED | Change the bundle operation timeout | ovn-db-01
2021-09-10 10:05:14.137982 | 001c2891-506d-f833-ff5a-000000000954 | TIMING | Change the bundle operation timeout | ovn-db-01 | 0:00:54.808754 | 0.77s
2021-09-10 10:05:14.146853 | 001c2891-506d-f833-ff5a-000000000956 | TASK | Acquire the cluster shutdown lock to stop pacemaker cluster
2021-09-10 10:05:14.508085 | 001c2891-506d-f833-ff5a-000000000956 | CHANGED | Acquire the cluster shutdown lock to stop pacemaker cluster | ovn-db-01
2021-09-10 10:05:14.509257 | 001c2891-506d-f833-ff5a-000000000956 | TIMING | Acquire the cluster shutdown lock to stop pacemaker cluster | ovn-db-01 | 0:00:55.180032 | 0.36s
2021-09-10 10:05:14.518668 | 001c2891-506d-f833-ff5a-000000000957 | TASK | Stop pacemaker cluster
2021-09-10 10:05:18.559627 | 001c2891-506d-f833-ff5a-000000000957 | CHANGED | Stop pacemaker cluster | ovn-db-01

2021-09-10 10:05:18.560561 | 001c2891-506d-f833-ff5a-000000000957 | TIMING | Stop pacemaker cluster | ovn-db-01 | 0:00:59.231336 | 4.04s
2021-09-10 10:05:18.569161 | 001c2891-506d-f833-ff5a-000000000958 | TASK | Start pacemaker cluster
2021-09-10 10:05:18.627924 | 001c2891-506d-f833-ff5a-000000000958 | SKIPPED | Start pacemaker cluster | ovn-db-01
2021-09-10 10:05:18.628678 | 001c2891-506d-f833-ff5a-000000000958 | TIMING | Start pacemaker cluster | ovn-db-01 | 0:00:59.299453 | 0.06s
2021-09-10 10:05:18.637292 | 001c2891-506d-f833-ff5a-000000000959 | TASK | Release the cluster shutdown lock
2021-09-10 10:05:18.694945 | 001c2891-506d-f833-ff5a-000000000959 | SKIPPED | Release the cluster shutdown lock | ovn-db-01
2021-09-10 10:05:18.695717 | 001c2891-506d-f833-ff5a-000000000959 | TIMING | Release the cluster shutdown lock | ovn-db-01 | 0:00:59.366493 | 0.06s
2021-09-10 10:05:18.704368 | 001c2891-506d-f833-ff5a-00000000095a | TASK | Clear ovndb cluster pacemaker error
2021-09-10 10:05:19.368816 | 001c2891-506d-f833-ff5a-00000000095a | FATAL | Clear ovndb cluster pacemaker error | ovn-db-01 | error={"changed": true, "cmd": "pcs resource cleanup ovn-dbs-bundle", "delta": "0:00:00.399084", "end": "2021-09-10 10:05:20
.044985", "msg": "non-zero return code", "rc": 1, "start": "2021-09-10 10:05:19.645901", "stderr": "Error: Unable to forget failed operations of resource: ovn-dbs-bundle\nError connecting to the CIB manager: Transport endpoint is not connected\nError perf
orming operation: Transport endpoint is not connected", "stderr_lines": ["Error: Unable to forget failed operations of resource: ovn-dbs-bundle", "Error connecting to the CIB manager: Transport endpoint is not connected", "Error performing operation: Tran
sport endpoint is not connected"], "stdout": "", "stdout_lines": []}

We cannot call pcs resource cleanup at step1, we must call it at step0 so we're
guaranteed that the cluster is up, no matter how heat/ansible decide to order
the update_tasks.

Note: This is the short-term less-invasive fix. The mid-long term fix
should be around verifying that we can now remove those workarounds
that were implemented for OVN bugs.

Closes-Bug: #1943254

commit_message:
Refactor bootloader csv file read to use csv module

Refactors the read of the CSV file denoting the authortative
bootloader to use, to utilize the python csv module instead of
string splitting.

Change-Id: I6be7c6b5970f8387be68b53a1dedb1d58e8bfea2

commit_message:
Update master for stable/xena

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/xena.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/xena.

commit_message:
Implement project personas for quotas and quota_classes

This commit updates the quota policies to use default roles provided by
keystone, including read-only support. This is inline with broader
changes across the OpenStack community to provide a more consistent
authorization experience.

Future changes will incorporate system scope when cinder fully supports
it.

This commit also updates the roles of a quotas test to not use the
'admin' role for checking the policy is not authorized. Instead, use
'member' and 'reader', which seem to be more realistic values for the
test since anyone with 'admin' can do just about anything in the
deployment.

Co-Authored-by: Alan Bishop <abishop@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I1b72a78180da46ff4a6257903d76069389f2a1f4

commit_message:
Reproduce bug/1943436

The added db tests reproduces the bug that
$ nova-manage db version fails with
AttributeError: 'Engine' object has no attribute 'get_main_option'
If the db is managed by alembic.

Change-Id: I0647bb8545c1464b521a1d866cf5ee674aea2eae
Related-Bug: #1943436

commit_message:
Remove SSL configuration section from docs

Since supporting only PY3 (Ussuri) Glance has not been supporting
termination of encrypted connection to the service [0]. The
section was left behind on the configuring doc.

[0] https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/glance/ussuri.html#security-issues

Change-Id: I9356bceb914327f526da7b727fa58522ae18856e
Closes-Bug: #1930597

The routed-networks.yaml template has a typo in it that causes it to
fail if you use it verbatim, or as the basis for your network data.

  Additional properties are not allowed (\"end'\" was unexpected)\n

Change-Id: Ie926afdf219179ac285be96b3f05a512c970be02
'}]
commit_message:
Fix typo in sample network data

The routed-networks.yaml template has a typo in it that causes it to
fail if you use it verbatim, or as the basis for your network data.

  Additional properties are not allowed (\"end'\" was unexpected)\n

This is because there is a trailing ' in the definition.

Change-Id: Ie926afdf219179ac285be96b3f05a512c970be02

commit_message:
NovaLiveMigrationPermitAutoConverge should default to True

This is to match NovaLiveMigrationPermitPostCopy which is going to be
disabled if needed on RT hosts and in DPDK situations.

Related: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1920229
Change-Id: I7aeb00994daac23bab890bc70e6fbfc2e1ee9a66
(cherry picked from commit 5539bd8c16d2b118826a16a832ce516583ef2ced)

commit_message:
Ensure all test bundles pick up vip from overlay

All of the test bundles deploy ironic-api in HA with hacluster,
however the bundles were using individual overlays that required
new overlays to be defined for each new bundle. Instead, let's
use a single local-charm-overlay.yaml.j2. This handles the
situation similar to how charm-octavia does.

Closes-Bug: #1934382
Change-Id: If79f39ad8a866494edbe1c6b61e233bd6f3adbd7
(cherry picked from commit 222e7e70c3b91ba5651f7eeb8e72b198ddedde2c)

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/xena

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/xena branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I8274a874dd9867bfb14b77b6d4891b26650d1bf0

commit_message:

allows to set the Kayobe environment.

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/xena branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Currently the logs get printed in Zuul job stdout and only a small portion
of them is redirected to a file - this patch changes that to send all output

'}]
commit_message:
CI: Fix get_logs.sh docker logs output

Currently the logs get printed in Zuul job stdout and only a small portion
of them is redirected to a file - this patch changes that to send all output
to desired files.

Change-Id: I45e937ec7c102e89edee20679b8959bf7f6c7152
(cherry picked from commit 923813ac4820044723814b777e4a39cb6eb273fe)

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/xena

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/xena branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

messages:
[{'account_id': 21420, 'date': '2021-09-10 20:44:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 21420, 'date': '2021-09-10 20:47:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 21420, 'date': '2021-09-10 20:47:50.000000000', 'content': 'Set Ready For Review'}, {'account_id': 21420, 'date': '2021-09-10 20:59:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Published edit on patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 21420, 'date': '2021-09-10 21:19:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Published edit on patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-09-13 07:27:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

Hello,

openstack-help is not managed by the coordinated release.

https://opendev.org/openstack/governance/src/branch/master/reference/projects.yaml#L1954'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-09-13 07:27:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

s/openstack-help/openstack-helm/'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2021-09-13 09:04:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

We could try to find a way to support release-highlights that are not releaseteam-managed but for now I agree, this won't work"}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-09-13 10:30:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

From a Xena viewpoint it's a bit late to introduce this kind of support.

Maybe by introducing another and separated repository?"}, {'account_id': 21420, 'date': '2021-09-13 14:00:18.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
