commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/xena

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/xena branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-06-24 16:30:24.000000000', 'message': 'Dynamic defaults for roles, networks, vips and bm

When running 'overcloud deploy' command look for dynamic
defaults file for these options:
  --roles-file, --network-file, --vip-file and
  --baremetal-deployment

When the option is set by the user, use the user provided
file and make sure a copy is created in the working
directory. If the argument is not set look in the working
directory for the file used previously and use that file.

The depends-on creates these "defaults" by running the
different nova-less/network-v2 export commands when
upgrading the undercloud. With this change the next
'overcloud deploy' after the undercloud upgrade will use
the correct files (unless the user set the args ...)

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org795773
Change-Id: I53ba631dc80428c6f1fe71c2bbfb0b5a36dd8f01

'}, {'created': '2021-06-29 07:07:11.000000000', 'message': 'Dynamic defaults for roles, networks, vips and bm

When running 'overcloud deploy' command look for dynamic
defaults file for these options:
  --roles-file, --network-file, --vip-file and
  --baremetal-deployment

When the option is set by the user, use the user provided
file and make sure a copy is created in the working
directory. If the argument is not set look in the working
directory for the file used previously and use that file.

overclod node, and overcloud network commands require the
user input. But will place a copy in the working_dir for
overcloud deploy.

The depends-on creates these "defaults" by running the
different nova-less/network-v2 export commands when
upgrading the undercloud. With this change the next
'overcloud deploy' after the undercloud upgrade will use
the correct files (unless the user set the args ...)

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/795773
Change-Id: I53ba631dc80428c6f1fe71c2bbfb0b5a36dd8f01

user input. But will place a copy in the working_dir for

different nova-less/network-v2 export commands when
upgrading the undercloud. With this change the next
'overcloud deploy' after the undercloud upgrade will use

commit_message:
Dynamic defaults for roles, networks, vips and bm

When running 'overcloud deploy' command look for dynamic
defaults file for these options:
  --roles-file, --network-file, --vip-file and
  --baremetal-deployment

When the option is set by the user, use the user provided
file and make sure a copy is created in the working
directory. If the argument is not set look in the working
directory for the file used previously and use that file.

overclod node, and overcloud network commands require the
user input. But will place a copy in the working_dir for
overcloud deploy.

The depends-on creates these "defaults" by running the
different nova-less/network-v2 export commands when
upgrading the undercloud. With this change the next
'overcloud deploy' after the undercloud upgrade will use
the correct files (unless the user set the args ...)

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/795773
Change-Id: I53ba631dc80428c6f1fe71c2bbfb0b5a36dd8f01

subject: Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/xena
messages: [{'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-09-13 13:24:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1\n\nThese changes are enough trivial to go with a single approval'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-10 14:35:48.000000000', 'message': 'Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/xena

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/xena branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I8879298372942dd6c953f1a44ea4d2c3ef86af45
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/xena

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/xena branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I8879298372942dd6c953f1a44ea4d2c3ef86af45

commit_message:
Run TripleO jobs on CentOS8 instead of CentOS7

As we are cleaning up the c7 jobs and obselete featuresets [1].
This change replaces usage of CentOS7 in TripleO jobs by CentOS8.

Currently the logs get printed in Zuul job stdout and only a small portion

commit_message:
CI: Fix get_logs.sh docker logs output

Currently the logs get printed in Zuul job stdout and only a small portion
of them is redirected to a file - this patch changes that to send all output
to desired files.

Change-Id: I45e937ec7c102e89edee20679b8959bf7f6c7152
(cherry picked from commit 923813ac4820044723814b777e4a39cb6eb273fe)

commit_message:
Add extension fwaas_v2 based on neutron-api relation data

fwaas_v2 extension is added in l3_agent.ini by default from stein.
However with the newly introduced neutron-api configuration parameter
enable-fwaas, the extension have to added only when it is set to true
on neutron-api charm.

neutron-api charm adds enabled-fwaas as relation data in the commit
https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/charm-neutron-api/+/806676.
This patch removes special handling of fwaas_v2 as l3_extension_plugins
is already updated in relation data based on neutron-api enable-fwaas
configuration.

Add python3-neutron-fwaas in py3 package list only for rocky release. The
package is already part of dependency of neutron-l3-agent until Ussuri
release and the dependency will be removed from Victoria release in
package control files.

Synced charmhelpers to get related changes
https://github.com/juju/charm-helpers/pull/635

Closes-Bug: #1934129
Change-Id: I1546f45635bfd7af76001c1df4f99d219a9d8039

commit_message:
Add extension fwaas_v2 based on neutron-api relation data

fwaas_v2 extension is added in l3_agent.ini by default from stein.
However with the newly introduced neutron-api configuration parameter
enable-fwaas, the extension have to added only when it is set to true
on neutron-api charm.

neutron-api charm adds enabled-fwaas as relation data in the commit
https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/charm-neutron-api/+/806676.
This patch removes special handling of fwaas_v2 as l3_extension_plugins
is already updated in relation data based on neutron-api enable-fwaas
configuration.

Remove python3-neutron-fwaas in package list from stein release. The
package is already part of dependency of neutron-l3-agent until Ussuri
release and the dependency will be removed from Victoria release in
package control files.

Synced charmhelpers to get related changes
https://github.com/juju/charm-helpers/pull/635

Partial-Bug: #1934129
Change-Id: I07db7fb7c2f00eaf4c0a5bcc082c73922b87d1c0

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-02 14:04:13.000000000', 'message': "Fix adding 'unknown' to the ConsumerTypeCache

The attribute cache added for consumer types in
I32499b2616e253a06f8a003fd3eef91006b58f42. It added the
`unknown` value to the cache as that is not persisted. But it
mixed up which internal dict represents which direction of
the cache and only populated one direction of the cache.
This is causes lookup errors for allocation with
consumer_type_id = None.

The cache is fixed now.

Story: 2009167
Task: 43183
Change-Id: I232acaad8b350b3cf924dd7a59d97eb8ad5d0fcc
"}]
commit_message:
Fix adding 'unknown' to the ConsumerTypeCache

The attribute cache added for consumer types in
I32499b2616e253a06f8a003fd3eef91006b58f42. It added the
`unknown` value to the cache as that is not persisted. But it
mixed up which internal dict represents which direction of
the cache and only populated one direction of the cache.
This is causes lookup errors for allocation with
consumer_type_id = None.

The cache is fixed now.

Story: 2009167
Task: 43183
Change-Id: I232acaad8b350b3cf924dd7a59d97eb8ad5d0fcc

commit_message:
Dependency reorganization

By adjusting the way we manage our tox dependencies
and increasing the number of mocked submodules during test runs and doc
building, we can minimize issues stemming from unexpected changes to constraints.

Patch also includes some style changes in the tox.ini file,
to harmonize the format of format definitions.

Closes-Bug: #1942508

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I73009d251f2c2a333903c02ab1c07c99247f73ab

commit_message:
Fix Elasticsearch Curator

Newest elasticsearch python library required by Curator does no longer
work against the last OSS version of Elasticsearch (7.10.2). Pin it
to the last known working version.

Closes-Bug: #1941073
Change-Id: Ic8f0554c95c1903640c98a7831b829c1f88f49ff
(cherry picked from commit f31fbab84f215e12e5042a948a81cde6b5831678)

commit_message:
Redefine "neutron-ovn-tempest-ovs-master-fedora" CI job

The CI job "neutron-ovn-tempest-ovs-master-fedora" should be the same
as "neutron-ovn-tempest-ovs-master" but executed in the Fedora nodeset.

Related-Bug: #1942913
Change-Id: I89700030dedab33c28baf95993206cf5cdd1e6d6

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-02 14:04:13.000000000', 'message': 'Reproduce 404 when allocation queried with 1.38

If an allocation is created with older than 1.38 then it is without
consumer_type then querying that allocation with 1.38 results in
HTTP 404 "No such consumer type: None." error.

This patch reproduces the error in the functional test environment.

Story: 2009167
Task: 43184
Change-Id: Ib65b79485780789463954aa7cc19ea7d1ed395a7
'}]
commit_message:
Reproduce 404 when allocation queried with 1.38

If an allocation is created with older than 1.38 then it is without
consumer_type then querying that allocation with 1.38 results in
HTTP 404 "No such consumer type: None." error.

This patch reproduces the error in the functional test environment.

Story: 2009167
Task: 43184
Change-Id: Ib65b79485780789463954aa7cc19ea7d1ed395a7

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/xena

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/xena branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/xena

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/xena branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ia73bed57d96c2ea1aaa2943433b77e02825bc01c

recheck'}, {'account_id': 32363, 'date': '2021-03-26 18:33:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(6 comments)

I left a few inline comments about the code, then went to test it on a "bionic" series [1] and got this error:

"""
Failed to discover available identity versions when contacting http://10.5.0.19:35357/v2.0. Attempting to parse version from URL.
"""

I used "codesearch" [2] to find inspiration on how to fix it, and I found this [3]. I tried something like this and it worked fine.
```python
...
project_name = rdata.get("service_tenant", None)
project_domain_name = rdata.get("service_domain", "default")  # add
user_domain_name = rdata.get("service_domain", "default")  # add
if protocol and host and port \
   and username and password and project_name:
    auth_url = "{}://{}:{}/".format(protocol,  # remove v2.0
                                    host,
                                    port)
    auth = identity.Password(auth_url=auth_url,
                             username=username,
                             password=password,
                             project_name=project_name,
                             user_domain_name=user_domain_name,  # add
                             project_domain_name=project_domain_name)  # add
...
```
---
[1]: https://pastebin.ubuntu.com/p/hg4Bz8SPt7/
[2]: https://codesearch.opendev.org/
[3]: https://opendev.org/openstack/charm-octavia/src/branch/master/src/lib/charm/openstack/api_crud.py#L110-L120'}, {'account_id': 32288, 'date': '2021-07-29 07:25:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 32288, 'date': '2021-07-29 07:38:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 24890, 'date': '2021-07-29 10:29:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

charm-recheck-full'}, {'account_id': 2424, 'date': '2021-08-30 16:59:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review-1

In general this LGTM. 

1) there is a quirk that will be relevant when this gets to be consumed by juju-verify,  it's that juju won't be keeping the format for the value associated with a key, for example in the case of get-status-dhcp the key will be `dhcp-networks` and the value a string that the consumer will need to pass through `yaml.safe_load()`

```
$ juju run-action neutron-gateway/0 --wait get-status-dhcp |  yq e '."unit-neutron-gateway-0".results'  -
dhcp-networks: |
  a5f535ac-6d74-49b3-b2e3-9b2c2c065c92:
    name: ext_net
    status: ACTIVE
  b304706a-9300-417e-8979-29e6701f0e01:
    name: private
    status: ACTIVE
```

2) About get-status-routers, in a cloud configured using `tox -e func-target -- focal-ussuri` I get an error:

```
$ openstack router list
+--------------------------------------+-----------------+--------+-------+----------------------------------+
| ID                                   | Name            | Status | State | Project                          |
+--------------------------------------+-----------------+--------+-------+----------------------------------+
| bc3007f0-4612-44de-ac6a-d597f7d62b3e | provider-router | ACTIVE | UP    | 904ba60073624cf49a1665c2110b7e9a |
+--------------------------------------+-----------------+--------+-------+----------------------------------+
$ juju run-action neutron-gateway/0 --wait get-status-routers
unit-neutron-gateway-0:
  UnitId: neutron-gateway/0
  id: "328"
  message: |-
    Action get-status-routers failed: The resource could not be found.
    Neutron server returns request_ids: ['req-96ee25c3-aad5-4806-97f6-7d91b1d07f30']
  results: {}
  status: failed
  timing:
    completed: 2021-08-30 16:48:21 +0000 UTC
    enqueued: 2021-08-30 16:48:15 +0000 UTC
    started: 2021-08-30 16:48:15 +0000 UTC
```

Relevant logs:

```
2021-08-30 16:48:20.885 60275 WARNING neutron.pecan_wsgi.controllers.resource [req-96ee25c3-aad5-4806-97f6-7d91b1d07f30 0b2739a6fd8849ffb2b9d78efbd6f5f2 f984aac1b24a4a929b71dc78292f2e85 - default default] No controller found for: l3-routers - returning response code 404: pecan.routing.PecanNotFound
2021-08-30 16:48:20.886 60275 INFO neutron.pecan_wsgi.hooks.translation [req-96ee25c3-aad5-4806-97f6-7d91b1d07f30 0b2739a6fd8849ffb2b9d78efbd6f5f2 f984aac1b24a4a929b71dc78292f2e85 - default default] GET failed (client error): The resource could not be found.
2021-08-30 16:48:20.892 60275 INFO neutron.wsgi [req-96ee25c3-aad5-4806-97f6-7d91b1d07f30 0b2739a6fd8849ffb2b9d78efbd6f5f2 f984aac1b24a4a929b71dc78292f2e85 - default default] 10.5.2.77 "GET /v2.0/agents/9ae8b8fa-36bc-4120-aca4-d0917c78f959/l3-routers HTTP/1.1" status: 404  len: 309 time: 0.0264456
```

3) This new set of actions need to be documented in the release notes for awareness of operators.'}, {'account_id': 30561, 'date': '2021-09-01 00:46:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

Please update the actions list in the README:

* `get-status-dhcp`                                                                                                                                          
* `get-status-lb`                                                                                                                                            
* `get-status-routers`'}, {'account_id': 33536, 'date': '2021-09-01 20:36:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

(4 comments)

@Martin Kalcok I've left some observations about using some of this code in charm-helpers for another charms and one issue that I found using the socket lib that might apply here also.

Regards"}, {'account_id': 32288, 'date': '2021-09-06 08:30:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

> Patch Set 9: Code-Review-1
> 
> 1) there is a quirk that will be relevant when this gets to be consumed by juju-verify,  it's that juju won't be keeping the format for the value associated with a key...

Yes, it's expected that juju-verify will use `yaml.safe_load()` to consume output of this action, similarly we use `json.loads()` for the actions that output data in "json-formatted" string.
  
> 2) About get-status-routers, in a cloud configured using `tox -e func-target -- focal-ussuri` I get an error:

I'll try to reproduce this but it's strange because func tests passed for the focal-ussuri combination.

> 3) This new set of actions need to be documented in the release notes for awareness of operators.

Will do.'}, {'account_id': 32288, 'date': '2021-09-06 12:23:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

(3 comments)

> Patch Set 9:

> > 2) About get-status-routers, in a cloud configured using `tox -e func-target -- focal-ussuri` I get an error:
> 
> I'll try to reproduce this but it's strange because func tests passed for the focal-ussuri combination.

I think I found a culprit. Functional tests for neutron-gateway run also OVS->OVN migration tests [1] which kills neutron-gateway L3 agents, so this is expected behavior, right?

[1] https://github.com/openstack-charmers/zaza-openstack-tests/blob/2aac7afa6fc78b0eb8172e9a5934ebb36855c4d8/zaza/openstack/charm_tests/ovn/tests.py#L194"}, {'account_id': 32288, 'date': '2021-09-06 12:51:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

[{'created': '2021-09-10 15:20:19.000000000', 'message': 'Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/xena

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/xena branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ie601b54851223b87055c500941760fde704c6548
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/xena

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/xena branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ie601b54851223b87055c500941760fde704c6548

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/xena

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/xena branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ib77827cf02882c59ea043527e624de3c3841f78e

commit_message:
Change default volume API to v3

Volumes v2 API was deprecated in pike and v3(.0)
 is identical to v2 API.
v3 was introduced in Mitaka

Change-Id: I38613145ae4234956f36184eb62feb8e95647113
(cherry picked from commit 7aa1fc69c31cf66e824875b24da10d1d6a1941e9)

subject: Allow purging policy files
messages: [{'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-09-04 12:47:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-09-04 12:56:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-09-09 16:02:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 30615, 'date': '2021-09-10 07:54:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2021-09-13 07:21:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-04 12:47:03.000000000', 'message': "Delete policy file if policies hash is empty

If all policies get deleted, previously created policy files won't
get removed and the api policy file is still used. Let's make
sure the policy file gets purged if the policies hash is empty.

Co-Authored-By: Martin Schuppert <mschuppert@redhat.com>
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/802305
Change-Id: I8e84349dd75908d22ba9cc570b633f2f57cff1bd
"}, {'created': '2021-09-04 12:56:35.000000000', 'message': 'Allow purging policy files

This change introduces the new purge_config parameter to the policy
class so that any policy rules not managed by puppet manifests can be
cleared.

Co-Authored-By: Martin Schuppert <mschuppert@redhat.com>
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/802305
Change-Id: I8e84349dd75908d22ba9cc570b633f2f57cff1bd
'}]
commit_message:
Allow purging policy files

This change introduces the new purge_config parameter to the policy
class so that any policy rules not managed by puppet manifests can be
cleared.

Co-Authored-By: Martin Schuppert <mschuppert@redhat.com>
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/802305
Change-Id: I8e84349dd75908d22ba9cc570b633f2f57cff1bd

This creates the stable/xena branch for all client
and non-client libraries now that we are past the
lib freeze on September 02.

someone from the team can -1 the patch to have it held,or update that

commit_message:
[cyborg] Create for all client and non-client lib xena branch

This creates the stable/xena branch for all client
and non-client libraries now that we are past the
lib freeze on September 02.

If a team wants to wait for a specific patch to make it to the library,
someone from the team can -1 the patch to have it held,or update that
patch with a different commit SHA.

Patches with no response will be merged by Friday, September 10.

Change-Id: I6a4ec3be85ece34a302a841b0f9ecef3f8e82870

commit_message:
Dependency reorganization

The constraints are now only used in cases where they do not conflict
with requirements for molecule tests.

The general test dependency list was changed to include ansible,
to allow running of the tests without installation of other,
tangentially related, dependencies from molecule requirements list.

Closes-Bug: #1942508

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I7cd1b93eedc64c90fe0863e57871378388c2ee85

role. Added home dir var to overcloud-delete role.

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-10 16:36:13.000000000', 'message': 'Call Engine.execute() in func tests for oslo.db 11.0.0

Since the requirements bump of oslo.db from 10.0.0 => 11.0.0, the
functional test jobs are failing with errors like this:

  sqlalchemy.exc.UnboundExecutionError: This Insert is not directly
  bound to a Connection or Engine. Use the .execute() method of a
  Connection or Engine to execute this construct.

This adjusts the insert/update statements to execute through the
Engine.execute() method as is directed in the error message.

Story: 2009209
Task: 43268

Change-Id: I0aa33ed4b131d254a4ec5b8477660990e097b77b
'}]
commit_message:
Call Engine.execute() in func tests for oslo.db 11.0.0

Since the requirements bump of oslo.db from 10.0.0 => 11.0.0, the
functional test jobs are failing with errors like this:

  sqlalchemy.exc.UnboundExecutionError: This Insert is not directly
  bound to a Connection or Engine. Use the .execute() method of a
  Connection or Engine to execute this construct.

This adjusts the insert/update statements to execute through the
Engine.execute() method as is directed in the error message.

Story: 2009209
Task: 43268

Change-Id: I0aa33ed4b131d254a4ec5b8477660990e097b77b

[{'created': '2021-09-04 12:52:14.000000000', 'message': "Delete policy file if policies hash is empty

If all policies get deleted, previously created policy files won't
get removed and the api policy file is still used. Let's make
sure the policy file gets purged if the policies hash is empty.

Co-Authored-By: Martin Schuppert <mschuppert@redhat.com>
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/802305
Change-Id: Id49fae0bd598ecaa863710a4da18f50a52eeaa68
"}, {'created': '2021-09-04 12:57:18.000000000', 'message': 'Allow purging policy files

This change introduces the new purge_config parameter to the policy
class so that any policy rules not managed by puppet manifests can be
cleared.

Co-Authored-By: Martin Schuppert <mschuppert@redhat.com>
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/802305
Change-Id: Id49fae0bd598ecaa863710a4da18f50a52eeaa68
'}]
commit_message:
Allow purging policy files

This change introduces the new purge_config parameter to the policy
class so that any policy rules not managed by puppet manifests can be
cleared.

Co-Authored-By: Martin Schuppert <mschuppert@redhat.com>
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/802305
Change-Id: Id49fae0bd598ecaa863710a4da18f50a52eeaa68

[{'created': '2021-09-03 11:11:42.000000000', 'message': 'Improve edge-case debugging for deployment and cleaning

* Log traceback in fail_on_error
  This is a last-resort error handler, it needs to log traceback.
* Use an assertion when we expect a present list of steps
* Log the freshly build list of steps.

Change-Id: I8cd4cd330551b7bc9a44957e0d15c8b75c09c299
(cherry picked from commit f6781aadfc38be1787b4cf6960640e253995f738)
'}]
commit_message:
Improve edge-case debugging for deployment and cleaning

* Log traceback in fail_on_error
  This is a last-resort error handler, it needs to log traceback.
* Use an assertion when we expect a present list of steps
* Log the freshly build list of steps.

Change-Id: I8cd4cd330551b7bc9a44957e0d15c8b75c09c299
(cherry picked from commit f6781aadfc38be1787b4cf6960640e253995f738)

commit_message:
Proposing Xena RC1 for ironic-prometheus-exporter

This proposed a RC1 release for ironic-prometheus-exporter to get any merged changes
out prior to the RC1 deadline for Xena going into effect.

If the team is ready to proceed, please leave a +1 to acknowledge this
release and we will process right away. If the team is working on any
final merges, leave a -1 with some detail on the status and update the
patch with the new commit hash to use when ready.

Patches with no response will be merged by Thursday, September 16.

$ git log --oneline --no-merges 2.2.0..40b9717
f0d5ab0 Explicity set IPE job to ML2/OVS
1492c4e Add lower-constraints job to current development branch
a75dcda setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores
02bb604 Remove lower-constraints job
5feed85 Changed minversion in tox to 3.18.0
89578a8 Replace deprecated UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE variable
eb0c919 Increase RAM for ironic vm
3071a19 Add Python3 xena unit tests
4840463 Update master for stable/wallaby

Signed-off-by: Hervé Beraud <hberaud@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ic32d401ab3f88491380efaf1150c096895c77202

commit_message:
Proposing Xena RC1 for ironic-ui

This proposed a RC1 release for ironic-ui to get any merged changes
out prior to the RC1 deadline for Xena going into effect.

If the team is ready to proceed, please leave a +1 to acknowledge this
release and we will process right away. If the team is working on any
final merges, leave a -1 with some detail on the status and update the
patch with the new commit hash to use when ready.

Patches with no response will be merged by Thursday, September 16.

$ git log --oneline --no-merges 4.3.0..0dd2333
0dd2333 Remove horizon from doc requirements
8459072 Remove lower-constraints job
accb839 Changed minversion in tox to 3.18.0
c4292aa setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores
258bd56 Remove testr
448f2c4 Drop horizon-nodejs10-jobs template
c0e3256 Add horizon-nodejs14-job template.
f219d0b Add Python3 xena unit tests

commit_message:
Add support for Ceph dashboard support

This change adds an admin-access interface to pass the admin
credentials and api endpoint details to another charm. The
dashboard charm uses this information registern the iscsi
gateways with the dashboard.

Change-Id: I5336ecab6a08e71dda22ba0347b8bee2f5683c3f

commit_message:
Remove ntp installation in ceph-fs.

For the case in container, it is not necessary to install ntp.
For the bare metal, we now expect operators to use a subordinate
ntp charm instead. Therefore, we remove ntp installation in
ceph-fs.

Closes-Bug: #1935013
Change-Id: I48f1a6a1ee6153bbc86cc9acf9302d8eb9d7db43

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-07-28 03:37:27.000000000', 'message': "Handle create_router when network and subnet exist

Subnets were not assigned if they already existed and were not created,
but the router creation code for the configure-resources depends on the
subnets variable for iteration. Initialize the subnets from the query
for the subnets for the case of existing subnets.

Additionally, the octavia charm uses a service user which can see other
subnets that are tagged 'charm-octavia'. Narrow the scope of the subnet
listing to the network being used by the charm.

Closes-Bug: #1866126
Change-Id: Id88a68a398a50532e11daff33fb774caf65a0c0a
"}, {'created': '2021-09-09 14:31:47.000000000', 'message': "Handle create_router when network and subnet exist

Subnets were not assigned if they already existed and were not created,
but the router creation code for the configure-resources depends on the
subnets variable for iteration. Initialize the subnets from the query
for the subnets for the case of existing subnets.

Additionally, the octavia charm uses a service user which can see other
subnets that are tagged 'charm-octavia'. Narrow the scope of the subnet
listing to the network being used by the charm.

Closes-Bug: #1866126
Change-Id: Id88a68a398a50532e11daff33fb774caf65a0c0a
Co-authored-by: Aurelien Lourot <aurelien.lourot@canonical.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Handle create_router when network and subnet exist

Subnets were not assigned if they already existed and were not created,
but the router creation code for the configure-resources depends on the
subnets variable for iteration. Initialize the subnets from the query
for the subnets for the case of existing subnets.

Additionally, the octavia charm uses a service user which can see other
subnets that are tagged 'charm-octavia'. Narrow the scope of the subnet
listing to the network being used by the charm.

Closes-Bug: #1866126
Change-Id: Id88a68a398a50532e11daff33fb774caf65a0c0a
Co-authored-by: Aurelien Lourot <aurelien.lourot@canonical.com>

commit_message:
Update master for stable/xena

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/xena.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on

and non-client libraries now that we are past the
lib freeze on September 02.

If a team wants to wait for a specific patch to make it to the library,

commit_message:
[blazar] Create for all client and non-client lib xena branch

This creates the stable/xena branch for all client
and non-client libraries now that we are past the
lib freeze on September 02.

If a team wants to wait for a specific patch to make it to the library,
someone from the team can -1 the patch to have it held,or update that
patch with a different commit SHA.

Patches with no response will be merged by Friday, September 10.

Change-Id: Iad31b135ab867712aae2f41d32a08dd787216a5f

commit_message:
Enable parallel downloads and allow tuning concurrency

Currently we set parallel_image_downloads to False, which means that
all downloads that go through the image cache are serialized.
This change enables it by default and deprecates in favour of a new
more fine-grained mechanism: the new option image_download_concurrency
specifies how many downloads (and raw conversions) will run in parallel.

Update logging to trace how long each download takes.

Change-Id: I8b85afda295029f85e82143cf7d4bcb2316860f6

commit_message:
Always update cache for HTTP images if Last Modified is unknown

Currently we default to assuming the cache is up-to-date. This is likely
wrong. Normal web servers provide Last Modified for files they serve.
If it is absent, chances are high the image is served by some sort
of a dynamic service, which may modify the URL on fly.

In any case, always updating the image is a safer choice.

Change-Id: I0548db14a97638d26ebb687e8f47f1b295d1f774

commit_message:
Add ETSI getting started

The current `Tacker User Guide` page doesn't have `Getting Started` for
ETSI NFV-SOL Tacker.

Added `Getting Started with ETSI NFV-SOL Tacker`.

Also, added sample files, such as a VIM config file, VNF packages and a
VNF instantiation parameters file, to the `samples` directory, which
are referred from the `Getting Started` page.

Change-Id: I58dadaa6c99fc45a34d87218c4d943e2572aa0a1
Signed-off-by: Hiromu Asahina <hiromu.asahina.az@hco.ntt.co.jp>

subject: Bind-mount /usr/share/zoneinfo
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 7353, 'name': 'Kevin Carter', 'email': 'kevin@cloudnull.com', 'username': 'cloudnull'}, {'_account_id': 8449, 'name': 'Marios Andreou', 'email': 'marios@redhat.com', 'username': 'marios'}, {'_account_id': 9976, 'name': 'Ronelle Landy', 'email': 'rlandy@redhat.com', 'username': 'rlandy'}, {'_account_id': 12393, 'name': 'chandan kumar', 'display_name': 'Chandan Kumar', 'email': 'chkumar@redhat.com', 'username': 'chkumar246'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 20172, 'name': 'Michele Baldessari', 'email': 'michele@acksyn.org', 'username': 'michele'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2021-09-03 09:02:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2021-09-03 09:37:32.000000000', 'content': 'Set Ready For Review'}, {'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2021-09-03 09:50:58.000000000', 'content': 'Hashtag added: cs9'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2021-09-03 11:44:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

So with this a standalone on cs9 host + cs9 containers works correctly. Not sure if this has any other implications though?
For example do we need to guarantee that tzdata is always installed on the host or is tzdata sufficiently low level that it will always be there? Also I hope tzdata is always compatible across versions so we do not introduce another host/container constraint'}, {'account_id': 12393, 'date': '2021-09-03 11:45:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Seems reasonable.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-09-03 13:58:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I'd kinda rather just put tzdata in base and not add even more mounts"}, {'account_id': 12393, 'date': '2021-09-03 13:59:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1
> 
> I'd kinda rather just put tzdata in base and not add even more mounts

Added here: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-common/+/800580/25/container-images/tcib/base/base.yaml#37"}, {'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2021-09-06 05:45:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1
> 
> I'd kinda rather just put tzdata in base and not add even more mounts

does bind-mount have any actual impact on perfs? Especially :ro without relabelling?"}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-09-07 13:59:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

it's more a complexity thing, we really need to stop bind mounting things from the host. My concern is also the re-usability of the containers and the impact this would have.  I believe it's better to reinstall tzdata for our use cases."}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-09-07 14:01:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

TBH this is a poor choice in the c9 containers.  They shouldn't be hacking (and breaking) a package's installation."}, {'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2021-09-13 05:51:12.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Agreeing with aschultz - reinstalling the tzdata within containers allows better portability.'}]

commit_message:
Bind-mount /usr/share/zoneinfo

With CS9 containers, /usr/share/zoneinfo is removed (gain: ~5Mo), and it
is expected the user to either bind-mount or re-install tzdata[1]

[1] https://gitlab.com/redhat/centos-stream/release-engineering/kickstarts/-/blob/main/CentOS-Stream-9-container-base.ks#L49-50

Change-Id: If3ae20794c2abd5b25fb19de18705a1655aec3aa

commit_message:
Remove duplicate namespace utilities in functional tests

We're in the process of adding test coverage for the metadef API, which
is sorely needed. This commit introduces two different base classes that
help consolidate some duplication that's grown across the metadef tests.

Since the metadef API contains a whole bunch of nest resources, the
first class is a set of utilities that are handy for creating
metadef resources. This is nice because almost every resources in the
metadef API needs a namespace.

The second class is a subclass of the functional test case, but provides
a layer for metadef-specific test utilities, like assertions. We can
continue using this layer to consolidate test utilities without bloating
the base functional test class.

Change-Id: Ic469ee50b9a3f162fd75a8290766d1e0bb4b26f5

WIP Add secure boot support to ubuntu.

This is WIP as it only installs the shim and signed EFI packages.
Custom distro code will be required to copy the required files to
/boot/efi/EFI

commit_message:
Switch to mariadb:10.5 module

In EL9, we are consuming mariadb:10.5, It adds the same for
EL8 also.

It also copies the required security_reset[1] file
needed for mariadb:10.5

[1]. https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-common/+/807577

Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I26174f6a450885fd65f8b1af5622d7d68c0aaf40

subject: JovianDSS: fix code style and naming

commit_message:
Remove parameters for the Spares Pool feature

... because these were deprecated during Wallaby cycle[1]. Actual
implementation was also removed from Octavia during Xena cycle[2].

[1] 46cffbd1e9229f587f3b6c703f4964aec4bab452
[2] 815a283823121d563562474eb9048673a95f6e1f

commit_message:
[stable-only] Fix lower-constraints

With the new pip resolver lower-constraints job fails due to
contradicting requirements. This patch eliminates all those
contradictions.

Change-Id: Iba8de3d17c7352138db316b9f842a4702a2648fb

commit_message:
Fix updating network provider attributes

The tests were failing due to:
* changed error message[0]
* and the following tests:
** test_create_network_provider_network_type
** test_update_network_provider_segmentation_id
were failing because only vlan type networks are supported.

[0] I2595335d6fbc51562b070f14eaeaadf49cf7c418

Change-Id: I4e2b8cd9b19796032a86d566c59f4518a0301e30
Story: 2005489
Task: 30589

[{'created': '2021-05-14 09:00:16.000000000', 'message': '[neutron] Get only ID and name of the SGs from Neutron

During the VM booting process Nova asks Neutron for the security groups
of the project. If there are no any fields specified, Neutron will
prepare list of security groups with all fields, including rules.
In case if project got many SGs, it may take long time as rules needs to
be loaded separately for each SG on Neutron's side.

During booting of the VM, Nova really needs only "id" and "name" of the
security groups so this patch limits request to only those 2 fields.

This lazy loading of the SG rules was introduced in Neutron in [1] and
[2].

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/630401/
[2] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/637407/

commit_message:
[neutron] Get only ID and name of the SGs from Neutron

During the VM booting process Nova asks Neutron for the security groups
of the project. If there are no any fields specified, Neutron will
prepare list of security groups with all fields, including rules.
In case if project got many SGs, it may take long time as rules needs to
be loaded separately for each SG on Neutron's side.

During booting of the VM, Nova really needs only "id" and "name" of the
security groups so this patch limits request to only those 2 fields.

This lazy loading of the SG rules was introduced in Neutron in [1] and
[2].

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/630401/
[2] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/637407/

Related-Bug: #1865223
Change-Id: I15c3119857970c38541f4de270bd561166334548

commit_message:
[SVF]:Fix multiple lshost calls during attach.

[Spectrum Virtualize Family] During attach or detach operation
there is multiple lshost calls from "get_host_from_connector",
which is causing some delay during attach or detach operations.

This patch fixes the issue by caching the host information during
initialization and searching for host from the cached information.

Closes-Bug: #1913363
Change-Id: I73e58f8b0f4908e9fb097f7ce151a9178cf6b96f

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-08 17:49:41.000000000', 'message': "Make signature verification go back to 'queued'

The image state diagram shows that for v2, any image upload failure
results in the image going back to 'queued' state. The old v1 path
used the 'killed' state, which is no longer value in image list
operations for v2. The signature verification error was sending the
image back to killed state still, which results in the user losing
visibility to the image entirely.

This removes the one last way we can get an image into killed state,
but there may still be images in the DB that have been orphaned in
this way, so some cleanup routine will be necesssary.

Change-Id: I9330cc42900dd019e9132c1f4e49eb9eff4f3fc9
Related-Bug: #1924612
"}]
commit_message:
Make signature verification go back to 'queued'

The image state diagram shows that for v2, any image upload failure
results in the image going back to 'queued' state. The old v1 path
used the 'killed' state, which is no longer value in image list
operations for v2. The signature verification error was sending the
image back to killed state still, which results in the user losing
visibility to the image entirely.

This removes the one last way we can get an image into killed state,
but there may still be images in the DB that have been orphaned in
this way, so some cleanup routine will be necesssary.

Change-Id: I9330cc42900dd019e9132c1f4e49eb9eff4f3fc9
Related-Bug: #1924612

[{'created': '2021-09-10 06:54:38.000000000', 'message': 'Make sure ovs-ofctl command exists

https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-quickstart/+/806955
adds Install and Restart openvswitch for upgrade to ussuri.

But it also prints version of openvswitch in the release file.
Most of the time ovs is not installed on the external node, it
leads to failure during repo-setup.

We need to make sure the command exists then print the version.

Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I399e08de5f69059ff5cd012b800f290eb6683936
'}]
commit_message:
Make sure ovs-ofctl command exists

https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-quickstart/+/806955
adds Install and Restart openvswitch for upgrade to ussuri.

But it also prints version of openvswitch in the release file.
Most of the time ovs is not installed on the external node, it
leads to failure during repo-setup.

We need to make sure the command exists then print the version.

Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I399e08de5f69059ff5cd012b800f290eb6683936

commit_message:
[Glusterfs]Fix create share from snapshot, "nfs.rpc-auth-allow" not initialized

Create share from snapshot, glusterfs volume "nfs.rpc-auth-allow" needs to be
initialized, otherwise it will inherit the value of the source volume

Closes-Bug: #1943035
Change-Id: If3c0e80e137cb58cd4eaf85fb251d082c1ad4359

commit_message:
Wait for objects creation

When using the gwcli, where possible, wait for objects to appear
before returning fro create command.

func-test-pr: https://github.com/openstack-charmers/zaza-openstack-tests/pull/633

Change-Id: I9564ca098942f8d76156d4459b39a98941ee232a

Given that this feature is implementing a new type of share, we ran the manila tempest plugin using FlexGroup shares.
So, we configured in our internal CI two jobs (DHSS True and False). They operated over FlexGroup pools.
Besides that, we provided a tempest patch [1] for overcoming the issues:

- Fix share size tempest configuration: FlexGroup must have at least 400G per aggregate, but not all tempest tests were following it;
- Add thin provisioning tempest configuration: FlexGroup requires much space, but our internal lab might not have it, so we run the tests as thin;

The manila plugin tests passed:

- False mode: experimental-manila-cDOT-FlexGroup-no-ss https://logs.openstack.netapp.com/logs/08/1508/22/downstream-experimental-flexgroup-no-ss/experimental-manila-cDOT-FlexGroup-no-ss/7c98766/ : SUCCESS in 4h 05m 40s

- True mode: experimental-manila-cDOT-FlexGroup-ss https://logs.openstack.netapp.com/logs/08/1508/21/downstream-experimental-flexgroup/experimental-manila-cDOT-FlexGroup-ss/f155ed7/ : SUCCESS in 3h 29m 27s

I did the QA for this patch, everything looks fine to me, so I'm giving a +1.

*Summary:*

To test the FlexGroups feature, three main scenarios were evaluated
  # Check the behavior of the backend configuration;
  # Test operations with FlexGroup shares;
  # Test operations with FlexGroup share using a scoped account;

The scenarios are detailed below. All tests passed, but there are some items that need some attention:\xa0
 
* In the tests with SVM Scoped Account, an item must be added in the documentation, explaining that the user need to have a readonly permission to access jobs in ONTAP, otherwise FlexGroups will not work
 
* In the tests with CIFS, an issue with mandatory network security service was found and fixed, so the tests were done considering this fix (https://bugs.launchpad.net/manila/+bug/1942124)
\xa0

---

\xa0

*Test Scenarios:*

(1) Check backend configuration behavior
 
* Test different configurations on the backend
    - add option `netapp_enable_flexgroup = True`
        -if False, service should not run
        -if True, and no other configuration is setted, only one pool is created with FlexGroup
 
* add the new option `netapp_flexgroup_pool`
    - if not specified the 'auto' option will be used by default
    - the admin can specify which aggregates will be used
    - test invalid flexgroup names (repeated names, or same name as an aggregate)
    - test using an invalid aggregate in the pool -> service does not run
 
* Test the option `netapp_flexgroup_pool_only`
    - if True, should prevent using FlexVols
    - if False, allow using FlexVols and FlexGroups together
    - if not setted, use the default True
 
* Create a share type with the capability `netapp_flexgroup = True`
 
* Check that the FlexGroup config does not work in ONTAP < 9.8
    - On ONTAP 9.6, driver should fail to run, returning an error -> service does not run, does not show an error

\xa0

(2) Test operations with FlexGroup shares

[Environment: ONTAP >= 9.8; DHSS True; and NFS/CIFS; FlexGroup Auto]
 
* Configure manila to use FlexGroup pool
 
* Create share
    - create volume with small size (should fail because FlexGroup is designed for large volumes)
    - check how the volumes are distributed in the constituents?
        -minimum size is 800GB (100 per constituent)
        -default is 100GB per constituent
        -size is divided equally between volumes
 
* Delete share
 
* Mount/Read/Write in share
    - should not be able to mount constituent
    - can read/write content
 
* Shrink share
    - Should not be able to shrink the size to less than 800GB
    - The content in the share must not be lost
 
* Extend share
    - Should increase equally the size of constituents
    - The content in the share must not be lost
 
* Manage/Unmanage shares
    - unmanage a FlexGroup share and try to manage it again
 
* Create snapshot
 * Create share from snapshot
    - In the same cluster
    - In a different cluster (use_scheduler_creating_share_from_snapshot = True and create a filter_function)
 
* Revert to snapshot
 
* Delete snapshot
 
* Manage/Unmanage snapshots
 
* Test share groups
    - create group of FlexGroup shares
    - execute some actions on group
        - group snapshot should take a snapshot from each volume
        - create share-group from snapshot
        - flexgroup does not support consistency group
        - sg_consistent_snapshot_support must be "None" when using flexgroup
 
* Access Rules
    - Read/Write permissions
        - To NFS: check export_location on ONTAP
        - To CIFS: check cifs share server permissions to user
* QoS
    - check the policies on ONTAP
        - volume show -fields policy-group
        - vserver export-policy rule show
    - ensure that qos policy is deleted when the volume is deleted and/or when an access-deny command is executed

* Share migration to other backend it's not supported, so need to check:
    - It does not allow to migrate a share member of a flexgroup
        - migration of a FlexGroup share reports the correct error on log
        - migrate a FlexVol share to a FlexGroup pool should report an error
        - migrate a FlexVol share to a FlexVol pool is still working

* Share server migration
    - Migration of server that contains flexgroup should fail
        - Error message: Cannot perform server migration because there is FlexGroup volume in the server.

* Check if available space is updated correctly (auto/manual)
    - it is not updated immediately, but only after running a job or restarting the services from manila

* Replication
    - create replica
    - delete replica
    - promote replica
    - read/write content
    - check replica synchronization
    - multiple replicas
        - FlexGroup is limited to one single replica for ONTAP version lower than 9.9.1.
             - Message in 9.8: Could not create replica <id> from share <id> in the destination host <backend-domain>. The share does not support more than one replica.
             - ONTAP 9.9.1 - works fine with multiple replicas

\xa0

(3) Test operations with FlexGroup share using a scoped account

[Environment: ONTAP >= 9.8; DHSS True; and NFS; FlexGroup Auto]
 * Create share
 * Delete share
 * Extend share
 * Shrink share
 * Access Rules
 * Read/Write
 * Create snapshot
 * Revert to snapshot
 * Delete snapshot
 * Create replica
 * Promote replica
 * Delete replica

\xa0

\xa0'}, {'account_id': 31721, 'date': '2021-09-02 17:02:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 31721, 'date': '2021-09-02 17:03:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-05 15:10:49.000000000', 'message': '[NetApp] Add FlexGroup volume support

The NetApp driver has been working with FlexVol ONTAP volumes. This
type of volume does not work well with large workloads, being over
one single node/aggregate. This patch changes that behavior by enabling
the provision of Manila shares as ONTAP FlexGroup volumes.

The FlexGroup pool is configured with a new option `netapp_flexgroup_pool`.
The pool for FlexGroup is different from the FlexVol one, the driver
can handle those two types of pools, either alone or together. For
having both, the new option `netapp_flexgroup_pool_only` must be
set to `False`. Each NetApp pool will report now the capability:
`netapp_is_flexgroup` informing which type the pool is.

The following operations are allowed with FlexGroup shares (DHSS
True/False and NFS/CIFS):

- Create/Delete share;
- Shrink/Extend share;
- Create/Delete snapshot;
- Revert to snapshot;
- Manage/Unmanage snapshots;
- Create from snapshot;
- Replication[1]
- Manage/Unmanage shares;

The backend with one FlexGroup pool configured will drop the consistent
snapshot support for all pools.

The driver FlexGroup support requires ONTAP version 9.8 or greater.

[1] FlexGroup is limited to one single replica for ONTAP version
lower than 9.9.1.

Implements: bp netapp-flexgroup-support
Change-Id: I4f68a9bb33be85f9a22e0be4ccf673647e713459
Signed-off-by: Felipe Rodrigues <felipefuty01@gmail.com>
'}, {'created': '2021-08-13 22:27:01.000000000', 'message': '[NetApp] Add FlexGroup volume support

The NetApp driver has been working with FlexVol ONTAP volumes. This
type of volume does not work well with large workloads, being over
one single node/aggregate. This patch changes that behavior by enabling
the provision of Manila shares as ONTAP FlexGroup volumes.

The FlexGroup provision is enabled by new option
`netapp_enable_flexgroup`, which will make the driver report a single
pool represeting all aggregates. The selection on which aggregates the
FlexGroup share will reside is up to ONTAP. If the administrator desires
to control that selection through Manila scheduler, it must inform the set
of aggregates that formss FlexGroup pool in the new  option
`netapp_flexgroup_pool`.

Each NetApp pool will report now the capability: `netapp_flexgroup`
informing which type the pool is.

The following operations are allowed with FlexGroup shares (DHSS
True/False and NFS/CIFS):

- Create/Delete share;
- Shrink/Extend share;
- Create/Delete snapshot;
- Revert to snapshot;
- Manage/Unmanage snapshots;
- Create from snapshot;
- Replication[1]
- Manage/Unmanage shares;

The backend with one FlexGroup pool configured will drop the consistent
snapshot support for all pools.

The driver FlexGroup support requires ONTAP version 9.8 or greater.

[1] FlexGroup is limited to one single replica for ONTAP version
lower than 9.9.1.

Implements: bp netapp-flexgroup-support
Change-Id: I4f68a9bb33be85f9a22e0be4ccf673647e713459
Signed-off-by: Felipe Rodrigues <felipefuty01@gmail.com>

'}, {'created': '2021-08-23 18:10:47.000000000', 'message': '[NetApp] Add FlexGroup volume support

The NetApp driver has been working with FlexVol ONTAP volumes. This
type of volume does not work well with large workloads, being over
one single node/aggregate. This patch changes that behavior by enabling
the provision of Manila shares as ONTAP FlexGroup volumes.

The FlexGroup provision is enabled by new option
`netapp_enable_flexgroup`, which will make the driver report a single
pool represeting all aggregates. The selection on which aggregates the
FlexGroup share will reside is up to ONTAP. If the administrator desires
to control that selection through Manila scheduler, it must inform the set
of aggregates that formss FlexGroup pool in the new  option
`netapp_flexgroup_pool`.

Each NetApp pool will report now the capability: `netapp_flexgroup`
informing which type the pool is.

The following operations are allowed with FlexGroup shares (DHSS
True/False and NFS/CIFS):

- Create/Delete share;
- Shrink/Extend share;
- Create/Delete snapshot;
- Revert to snapshot;
- Manage/Unmanage snapshots;
- Create from snapshot;
- Replication[1]
- Manage/Unmanage shares;

The backend with one FlexGroup pool configured will drop the consistent
snapshot support for all pools.

The driver FlexGroup support requires ONTAP version 9.8 or greater.

[1] FlexGroup is limited to one single replica for ONTAP version
lower than 9.9.1.

Depends-On: If525e97a5d456d6ddebb4bf9bc8ff6190c95a555
Depends-On: I646f782c3e2be5ac799254f08a248a22cb9e0358
Implements: bp netapp-flexgroup-support
Change-Id: I4f68a9bb33be85f9a22e0be4ccf673647e713459
Signed-off-by: Felipe Rodrigues <felipefuty01@gmail.com>

commit_message:
[NetApp] Add FlexGroup volume support

The NetApp driver has been working  with FlexVol ONTAP volumes.
The driver does not support scaling FlexVol volumes higher than
100 TiB, which was a theoretical limit for the large namespace that
these containers were meant to handle. ONTAP's Flexgroup volumes
eliminate such limitations. So, added the support for provisioning
share as FlexGroup in the NetApp driver.

The FlexGroup provision is enabled by new option
`netapp_enable_flexgroup`, which will make the driver report a single
pool represeting all aggregates. The selection on which aggregates the
FlexGroup share will reside is up to ONTAP. If the administrator desires
to control that selection through Manila scheduler, it must inform the set
of aggregates that formss FlexGroup pool in the new  option
`netapp_flexgroup_pool`.

Each NetApp pool will report now the capability: `netapp_flexgroup`
informing which type the pool is.

The following operations are allowed with FlexGroup shares (DHSS
True/False and NFS/CIFS):

- Create/Delete share;
- Shrink/Extend share;
- Create/Delete snapshot;
- Revert to snapshot;
- Manage/Unmanage snapshots;
- Create from snapshot;
- Replication[1]
- Manage/Unmanage shares;

The backend with one FlexGroup pool configured will drop the consistent
snapshot support for all pools.

The driver FlexGroup support requires ONTAP version 9.8 or greater.

[1] FlexGroup is limited to one single replica for ONTAP version
lower than 9.9.1.

DocImpact

Depends-On: If525e97a5d456d6ddebb4bf9bc8ff6190c95a555
Depends-On: I646f782c3e2be5ac799254f08a248a22cb9e0358
Implements: bp netapp-flexgroup-support
Change-Id: I4f68a9bb33be85f9a22e0be4ccf673647e713459
Signed-off-by: Felipe Rodrigues <felipefuty01@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Update master for stable/xena

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/xena.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/xena.

Sem-Ver: feature

[{'created': '2020-02-04 12:58:14.000000000', 'message': "hardware: Add TODO to remove '(un)pin_cpu_with_siblings'

With the newly introduced translation of 'hw:cpu_thread_policy' to
require or avoid the 'HW_CPU_HYPERTHREADING' trait, we no longer fake
non-SMT hosts by reserving the thread siblings of each core used by an
instance. As such, once we're in a world where all hosts have switched
to reporting PCPUs and this trait (or at least are capable of it), we
will no longer need the functionality these methods enable. Add a TODO
to remind us to remove them.

Change-Id: I22032f5a96c3ba791d3b44b83259b43349093c36
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
hardware: Add TODO to remove '(un)pin_cpu_with_siblings'

With the newly introduced translation of 'hw:cpu_thread_policy' to
require or avoid the 'HW_CPU_HYPERTHREADING' trait, we no longer fake
non-SMT hosts by reserving the thread siblings of each core used by an
instance. As such, once we're in a world where all hosts have switched
to reporting PCPUs and this trait (or at least are capable of it), we
will no longer need the functionality these methods enable. Add a TODO
to remind us to remove them.

Change-Id: I22032f5a96c3ba791d3b44b83259b43349093c36
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix the CephDashboardNetwork default

The Ceph Dashboard uses by default the Grafana network to bind the
overcloud backends to the specified port.
However, the CephDashboardNetwork parameter is used to define the
haproxy frontend and the related vip, used to reach the Ceph backends.
The purpose of this patch is to make sure the right defaults are
used for TripleO deployed Ceph clusters.

Change-Id: I1dd5581317462f638185c918c85c86f953ddf28f
(cherry picked from commit ae139dec649a413a626549bcb5c1de794383be40)
(cherry picked from commit 884d9bf2aabe8bdac831e0c63b0a2ab1653795e8)

commit_message:
Fix gate: fix the failing network, image, volume RBAC test

1. Image update member test is failing because image owner
itself try to update the image member status but only
admin or that member can update it. Fixing this test.

2. Network tests are failing to create public network
on vxlan or so, fixing those with right parameters.

3. Volume type extra type specs is facing the race condition,
where same name specs is created for all the test which update
delete it. But still it fails so skipping this test too for now.

4. Skipping volume detach test for now, basically squashing
https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/patrole/+/800594

Story: 2009210
Task: 43272
Story: 2009050
Task: 42820

Change-Id: I5fbcaf219d23d5c94a180c3447ca851d844e1dca

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-08 11:26:09.000000000', 'message': '[NetApp] Fixed scoped account replica delete

In the ONTAP 9.8 and older, there is a bug in the zapi call
`snapmirror-release-iter` when using the scoped account
configuration. The operation is returning success, but the release
is not occurring.

To avoid this issue, the Netapp driver was changed to release with
the `snapmirror-release` zapi call, instead of the one that has a
bug. This new zapi call requires the field `relationship-id` to be
specified and it is being retrieved from ONTAP before calling it.

A small fix, not related to the bug, was made in the zapi call to
`snapmirror-release-iter` because the `relationship-info-only`
field was in the wrong place according to the documentation.

Closes-Bug: #1934889
Change-Id: I21633d4ffe14983365b0b6239216ed5d0bbfaace
(cherry picked from commit a745e9c7c48f0bfdd830f13094f588fe085b4845)
(cherry picked from commit 24545ad9172afcacc1d63a8b972e421c1db24035)
'}]
commit_message:
[NetApp] Fixed scoped account replica delete

In the ONTAP 9.8 and older, there is a bug in the zapi call
`snapmirror-release-iter` when using the scoped account
configuration. The operation is returning success, but the release
is not occurring.

To avoid this issue, the Netapp driver was changed to release with
the `snapmirror-release` zapi call, instead of the one that has a
bug. This new zapi call requires the field `relationship-id` to be
specified and it is being retrieved from ONTAP before calling it.

A small fix, not related to the bug, was made in the zapi call to
`snapmirror-release-iter` because the `relationship-info-only`
field was in the wrong place according to the documentation.

Closes-Bug: #1934889
Change-Id: I21633d4ffe14983365b0b6239216ed5d0bbfaace
(cherry picked from commit a745e9c7c48f0bfdd830f13094f588fe085b4845)
(cherry picked from commit 24545ad9172afcacc1d63a8b972e421c1db24035)

commit_message:
Revert "Deprecate warnings for Ceilometer and Gnocchi"

This reverts commit 88ef2afcbf9670fdd5bffced4564f2107ba06699.

Reason for revert:
Ceilometer and Gnocchi are not deprecated in tripleo-heat-templates.
The current warning in puppet-tripleo gives a wrong notice to users.
Deprecation should happen in a consistent manner within all TripleO
repos.

Conflicts:
	manifests/profile/base/gnocchi.pp

Change-Id: I41ebb5c84db3cffa897c259729caa6b5247dd0e9
(cherry picked from commit 8a2dd483942675622c90d04fb36fe607564e1d30)
(cherry picked from commit fdb8ee10ba2550037152bcad5f1060e153edc5d9)

commit_message:
Remove 'enable_v3_api' option

This option is now superfluous.  Its removal without deprecation in the
Xena release was discussed on the mailing list:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-July/023898.html

Change-Id: I21bf938d69a2656eff3783a1d1274a6972a44c88

This is a followup patch for change
I887606047ac1da3f2c59c17988ddcc17bd01ef43 to refactor repeated code
into a common utility function. Note that the logic for deleting
consumers is kept separate because the consumer deletes need to be done

commit_message:
Commonize code for updating and creating allocations

This is a followup patch for change
I887606047ac1da3f2c59c17988ddcc17bd01ef43 to refactor repeated code
into a common utility function. Note that the logic for deleting
consumers is kept separate because the consumer deletes need to be done
in a separate database transaction from the consumer updates and
allocation creates.

Change-Id: I9d02836c976140689c103e5b559e0221651907f8

commit_message:
Donot trigger undercloud upgrade jobs on standalone fs

Currently undercloud-upgrade jobs are getting triggered on
standalone featureset files changes [1] leading to Zuul job
freeze issue.

Under undercloud-upgrade job's undercloud_ignored [2] files list
standalone featuresets are missing.

Adding the same fixes the issue.
It also includes ovb, updates and upgrade featuresets.

[1.] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-quickstart/+/801261
[2.] https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci/src/branch/master/zuul.d/upgrades-jobs-templates.yaml#L48
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Id97a3467266d0967d1cb7ca80f63b4050a28b4e2

subject: Add cross-placement jobs
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-10 21:57:03.000000000', 'message': 'Add cross-placement jobs

A recent requirements bump of oslo.db from 10.0.0 => 11.0.0 [1] caused
failures in the placement project gate, in the functional tests.

This raised awareness that we have not had cross jobs checking with
placement since placement was split out from nova during the Train
cycle.

This adds cross-placement jobs which correspond to the existing
cross-nova ones.

Story: 2009209
Task: 43275

[1] I03d79b19774650f3df7129157e6a12998fd33447

Change-Id: I625b2345248f2198ea264e7cafbe6e93e4ba4a1e
'}]
commit_message:
Add cross-placement jobs

A recent requirements bump of oslo.db from 10.0.0 => 11.0.0 [1] caused
failures in the placement project gate, in the functional tests.

This raised awareness that we have not had cross jobs checking with
placement since placement was split out from nova during the Train
cycle.

This adds cross-placement jobs which correspond to the existing
cross-nova ones.

Story: 2009209
Task: 43275

[1] I03d79b19774650f3df7129157e6a12998fd33447

Change-Id: I625b2345248f2198ea264e7cafbe6e93e4ba4a1e

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/victoria

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/victoria branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I9ba6588f82b1946bd8cd097f4d3e3152d3695b09

commit_message:
Update master for stable/victoria

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/victoria.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/victoria.

Sem-Ver: feature

subject: setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores
messages: [{'account_id': 33161, 'date': '2021-05-05 02:41:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 33161, 'date': '2021-05-05 02:42:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-05-17 16:39:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-06-06 23:44:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2021-09-10 13:54:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-05 02:41:40.000000000', 'message': 'setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Change-Id: Ia23c43d393091291bdcfcb36858677972e2cfb52
'}, {'created': '2021-05-05 02:42:18.000000000', 'message': "setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: Ia23c43d393091291bdcfcb36858677972e2cfb52
"}]
commit_message:
setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: Ia23c43d393091291bdcfcb36858677972e2cfb52

messages: [{'account_id': 17216, 'date': '2021-09-02 09:41:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 17216, 'date': '2021-09-03 08:19:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\ncheck-rdo'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-09-10 13:17:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-02 09:41:01.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Disable postcopy for ovn/ovs-dpdk"

This reverts commit 9b9a5d4c77415ccae55111ec60835e074eb8aab8.

Reason for revert: 
postcopy gets enabled per default if the it is not a realtime node [1].
To have postcopy to work ovs needs to be started with --mlockall=no. This is now done via [2].

[1] https://review.opendev.org/q/If8958c414c400026c66187261d8fff439aad6388
[2] https://review.opendev.org/q/I670b31a921a163f286a8267b808d6d97cc5a61c1

Change-Id: I9007749cc1b5325abb7cd5330d9b2fc518a7ff54
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Disable postcopy for ovn/ovs-dpdk"

This reverts commit 9b9a5d4c77415ccae55111ec60835e074eb8aab8.

Reason for revert: 
postcopy gets enabled per default if the it is not a realtime node [1].
To have postcopy to work ovs needs to be started with --mlockall=no. This is now done via [2].

[1] https://review.opendev.org/q/If8958c414c400026c66187261d8fff439aad6388
[2] https://review.opendev.org/q/I670b31a921a163f286a8267b808d6d97cc5a61c1

Change-Id: I9007749cc1b5325abb7cd5330d9b2fc518a7ff54

commit_message:
Revert "Disable postcopy for ovn/ovs-dpdk"

This reverts commit 251a1d238cd85cfb56a4de378edb118d9c3836dc.

Reason for revert: 
postcopy gets enabled per default if the it is not a realtime node [1].
To have postcopy to work ovs needs to be started with --mlockall=no. This is now done via [2].

[1] https://review.opendev.org/q/If8958c414c400026c66187261d8fff439aad6388
[2] https://review.opendev.org/q/I670b31a921a163f286a8267b808d6d97cc5a61c1

Change-Id: I3a81a3989fcf961e217c7dd50bd993dff8e02ce9

[doc] port-resource-request-groups not landed in Xena

resource request support in nova as the neutron API extension did not
land in Xena.

commit_message:
Update master for stable/xena

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/xena.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/xena.

Sem-Ver: feature
Change-Id: I62ae17b426c970e0e595210da0d7656f70b37352

subject: Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/xena
messages: [{'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2021-09-10 22:25:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-10 14:32:43.000000000', 'message': 'Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/xena

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/xena branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I483bde45727a7be8d26f982ed3b24bf2a5ef625a
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/xena

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/xena branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I483bde45727a7be8d26f982ed3b24bf2a5ef625a

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-10 10:16:24.000000000', 'message': "Stop explicitly supported Fedora

It's a moving target that keeps breaking. Right now it's broken because
removing openssl-devel causes removal of dkms, which DIB insists on
installing.

Document the supported distributions based on what the CI runs
(yes, it's Ubuntu Bionic and openSUSE 15.1, there is no mistake).

Change-Id: I08263751ca158db5883d95407ad0f3c9807826eb
"}]
commit_message:
Stop explicitly supported Fedora

It's a moving target that keeps breaking. Right now it's broken because
removing openssl-devel causes removal of dkms, which DIB insists on
installing.

Document the supported distributions based on what the CI runs
(yes, it's Ubuntu Bionic and openSUSE 15.1, there is no mistake).

Change-Id: I08263751ca158db5883d95407ad0f3c9807826eb

Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/xena

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/xena branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-04-08 13:29:35.000000000', 'message': 'Fix image/tasks API for in-progress tasks

A slight error in the tasks_get_by_image() DB API method resulted in
our excluding in-progress tasks from the returned list. This is
because those tasks have expires_at=NULL, and we were comparing
the expires_at>=$NOW to find unexpired tasks. This makes us check for
"NULL or not expired" instead.

We did have a test asserting the wrong behavior, but it was done to
increase coverage and thus was asserting the behavior of the code and
not the *desired* behavior. This fixes that as well.

Closes-Bug: #1922928
Change-Id: I1b6971888673b64ef60bed8fbcc97bbcbcf5c2ac
(cherry picked from commit 2a0d2303c3346b3e771a40c0fe4d4dceaf16f992)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix image/tasks API for in-progress tasks

A slight error in the tasks_get_by_image() DB API method resulted in
our excluding in-progress tasks from the returned list. This is
because those tasks have expires_at=NULL, and we were comparing
the expires_at>=$NOW to find unexpired tasks. This makes us check for
"NULL or not expired" instead.

We did have a test asserting the wrong behavior, but it was done to
increase coverage and thus was asserting the behavior of the code and
not the *desired* behavior. This fixes that as well.

Closes-Bug: #1922928
Change-Id: I1b6971888673b64ef60bed8fbcc97bbcbcf5c2ac
(cherry picked from commit 2a0d2303c3346b3e771a40c0fe4d4dceaf16f992)

commit_message:
NovaLiveMigrationPermitAutoConverge should default to True

This is to match NovaLiveMigrationPermitPostCopy which is going to be
disabled if needed on RT hosts and in DPDK situations.

Related: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1920229
Change-Id: I7aeb00994daac23bab890bc70e6fbfc2e1ee9a66
(cherry picked from commit 5539bd8c16d2b118826a16a832ce516583ef2ced)
(cherry picked from commit 97120538457dc09298e9377fbbc155e79c02bfc9)
(cherry picked from commit b0c5c80e04bf9876c0cbc84e59dc607a20d52f3d)

commit_message:
Add CephRbdTrashPurgeInterval parameter

When ceph is deployed via TripleO, during the overcloud deployment
phase the tripleo_cephadm role is able to add a new trash purge
scheduler. This change exposes the tripleo CephRbdTrashPurgeInterval
which defines the interval that will be applied to the scheduler.

Depends-On: Ide51ba4cef7c9f0df78d505f7429745285d7d484
Change-Id: I6d560bbd67958ec484248ad0b20ef30f1f9593b8

commit_message:
Add rbd trash purge scheduler to the Ceph conf

This change adds the ability to configure a new rbd
trash purge scheduler passing an interval as parameter.

Change-Id: Ide51ba4cef7c9f0df78d505f7429745285d7d484

commit_message:
Fix the CephDashboardNetwork default

The Ceph Dashboard uses by default the Grafana network to bind the
overcloud backends to the specified port.
However, the CephDashboardNetwork parameter is used to define the
haproxy frontend and the related vip, used to reach the Ceph backends.
The purpose of this patch is to make sure the right defaults are
used for TripleO deployed Ceph clusters.

Change-Id: I1dd5581317462f638185c918c85c86f953ddf28f
(cherry picked from commit ae139dec649a413a626549bcb5c1de794383be40)
(cherry picked from commit 884d9bf2aabe8bdac831e0c63b0a2ab1653795e8)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-08 17:24:01.000000000', 'message': '[DNM] Retry object creation on 409 Conflict

[ DNM --- untested, for discussion purposes only --- DNM ]

In some cases (such as when using Ceph RADOSGW with a load-balancer)
it's possible that the container (bucket) creation will be received by
different backend to the object creation request, triggering a subtle
edge case.

A second rgw, handling the object creation request has (cached)
knowledge the bucket doesn't exist (it didn't a few seconds ago) and
will therefore (in rgw) create it, at which point triggering a "409
BucketAlreadyExists" code.

Detecting this and retrying (with a small delay) should reduce
instances of this failing.

Change-Id: Id88fb93dd1a48d046917e9168d623e53497ec83e

commit_message:
object_storage: retry object creation on Conflict

In some cases (such as when using Ceph RADOSGW with a load-balancer)
the container (bucket) creation will be received by different backend
to the object creation triggering a subtle edge case.

The rgw handling the object creation request has (cached) knowledge
the bucket doesn't exist (it didn't a few seconds ago) and will (in
rgw) create it, at which point triggering a "409 BucketAlreadyExists"
code.

Detecting this and retrying (with a small delay) should reduce
instances of this failing.

Change-Id: Id88fb93dd1a48d046917e9168d623e53497ec83e

> Nevermind, the thing I thought would work did not work. This might anyway be better thing as it minimizes the writes in the single transaction to only the consumer updates and the allocation updates. We noticed many more conflict collisions with consumer types and it might have been because there was too much in one transaction (?)

OK, so I realized that the reason the other approach I tried didn’t work is because I was testing with the func test framework and SQLite. SQLite doesn’t have transaction isolation. The MySQL opportunistic test base would need to be used to test the other approach properly.

Which is: I think another way to do this would be to add a “with db_api.placement_context_manager.writer.independent.using(context):” around each of the “get after create failed with already exists” calls. The independent would make the get use a separate transaction.

That change would be a lot smaller and simpler but the trade off is the outer transaction would still cover a lot (too much?). Anyway it’s another option.'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2021-09-02 10:14:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-02 02:50:17.000000000', 'message': 'Narrow scope of set allocations database transaction

When consumer types were added[1], the set allocations code path was
modified to perform util.ensure_consumer() and
AllocationList.replace_all() in a single database transaction in order
to provide automatic rollbacks of consumer type changes by racing
requests.

This proved to be problematic because util.ensure_consumer() contains
logic to "get or create" database records for project, user, consumer
type, and consumer. By definition, the "get or create" pattern cannot
reside in the same database transaction else a DuplicateEntry database
error followed by an attempt to "get" the existing record will fail as
the single database transaction is being rolled back and no new
statements can be executed.

Because of this, we cannot wrap util.ensure_consumer() under the same
database transaction as Allocation.replace_all() and we need to reduce
the scope of the database transaction to cover only the updates to a
consumer (if the requested project/user/consumer type differ from what
was found in the database) and the write of the allocation records.

This changes things around to stop performing "difference" updates
inside of the util.ensure_consumer() method and instead return what was
requested as an additional return value. Then, we move the database
transaction to cover only util.update_consumers() and
AllocationList.replace_all() so that if replace_all() fails due to a
generation conflict, the consumer updates will also be rolled back.

This approach was chosen in an effort to introduce the least amount of
change to the existing understood code.

commit_message:
Narrow scope of set allocations database transaction

When consumer types were added [1], the set allocations code path was
modified to perform util.ensure_consumer() and
AllocationList.replace_all() in a single database transaction in order
to provide automatic rollbacks of consumer type changes by racing
requests.

This proved to be problematic because util.ensure_consumer() contains
logic to "get or create" database records for project, user, consumer
type, and consumer. By definition, the "get or create" pattern cannot
reside in the same database transaction else a DuplicateEntry database
error followed by an attempt to "get" the existing record will fail as
the single database transaction is being rolled back and no new
statements can be executed.

Because of this, we cannot wrap util.ensure_consumer() under the same
database transaction as Allocation.replace_all() and we need to reduce
the scope of the database transaction to cover only the updates to a
consumer (if the requested project/user/consumer type differ from what
was found in the database) and the write of the allocation records.

This changes things around to stop performing "difference" updates
inside of the util.ensure_consumer() method and instead return what was
requested as an additional return value. Then, we move the database
transaction to cover only util.update_consumers() and
AllocationList.replace_all() so that if replace_all() fails due to a
generation conflict, the consumer updates will also be rolled back.

This approach was chosen in an effort to introduce the least amount of
change to the existing understood code.
